Anna Karenina

Vengeance be mine ; I will repay .
volume one part I
all happy families resemble one another , but each unhappy family be unhappy in its own way .
everything be upset in the Oblonskys ' house .
the wife have discover an intrigue between her husband and their former french governess , and declare that she would not continue to live under the same roof with he .
this state of thing have now last for three day , and not only the husband and wife but the rest of the family and the whole household suffer from it .
they all feel that there be no sense in their live together , and that any group of people who have meet together by chance at an inn would have have more in common than they .
the wife keep to her own room , the husband stop away from home all day ; the child run about all over the house uneasily , the english governess quarrel with the housekeeper and write to a friend ask if she could find she another situation ; the cook have go out just at dinner - time the day before and have not return ; and the kitchen - maid and coachman have give notice .
on the third day after his quarrel with his wife , Prince Stephen Arkadyevich Oblonsky – Steve , as he be call in his set in Society – wake up at his usual time , eight o'clock , not in his wife 's bedroom but on the morocco leather - cover sofa in his study .

and the detail of his quarrel with his wife , his inextricable position , and , bad of all , his guilt , rise up in his imagination .
' no , she will never forgive I ; she can not forgive I !
and the bad thing about it be , that it be all my own fault – my own fault ; and yet I be not guilty !
that be the tragedy of it ! ' he think . ' oh dear , oh dear ! ' he mutter despairingly , as he recall the most painful detail of the quarrel .

at that moment there have happen to he what happen to most people when unexpectedly catch in some shameful act : he have not have time to assume an expression suitable to the position in which he stand toward his wife now that his guilt be discover .
instead of take offence , deny , make excuse , ask forgiveness , or even remain indifferent ( anything would have be well than what he do ) , he involuntarily ( ' reflex action of the brain , ' think Oblonsky , who be fond of physiology ) smile his usual kindly and therefore silly smile .
he could not forgive himself for that silly smile .

since then she have refuse to see he .
' it be all the fault of that stupid smile , ' think Oblonsky . '
but what be I to do ? what can I do ? ' he ask himself in despair , and could find no answer .
OBLONSKY be TRUTHFUL with himself .
he be incapable of self - deception and could not persuade himself that he repent of his conduct .
he could not feel repentant that he , a handsome amorous man of thirty - four , be not in love with his wife , the mother of five living and two dead child and only a year young than himself .
he repent only of not having manage to conceal his conduct from she .
nevertheless he feel his unhappy position and pity his wife , his child , and himself .
he might perhaps have be able to hide thing from she have he know that the knowledge would so distress she .
he have never clearly consider the matter , but have a vague notion that his wife have long suspect he of be unfaithful and wink at it .
he even think that she , who be nothing but an excellent mother of a family , wear - out , already grow elderly , no long pretty , and in no way remarkable – in fact , quite an ordinary woman – ought to be lenient to he , if only from a sense of justice .
it turn out that the very opposite be the case .
oh dear , oh dear , how awful ! ' Oblonsky keep repeat to himself , and could arrive at no conclusion .
' and how well everything be go on till now – how happily we live ! she be contented , happy in her child ; I never interfere with she but leave she to fuss over they and the household as she please ...

chapter III

Oblonsky subscribe to and read a liberal paper – not an extreme liberal paper but one that express the opinion of the majority .
and although neither science , art , nor politic specially interest he , he firmly hold to the opinion of the majority and of his paper on those subject , change his view when the majority change theirs , – or rather , not change they – they change imperceptibly of their own accord .
Oblonsky 's tendency and opinion be not his by deliberate choice : they come of themselves , just as he do not choose the fashion of his hat or coat but wear those of the current style .
live in a certain social set , and have a desire , such as generally develop with maturity , for some kind of mental activity , he be oblige to hold view , just as he be oblige to have a hat .
if he have a reason for prefer Liberalism to the Conservatism of many in his set , it be not that he consider Liberalism more reasonable , but because it suit his manner of life well .
the Liberal Party maintain that everything in Russia be bad , and it be a fact that Oblonsky have many debt and decidedly too little money .
the Liberal Party say that marriage be an obsolete institution which ought to be reform ; and family life really give Oblonsky very little pleasure , force he to tell lie and dissemble , which be quite contrary to his nature .
the Liberal Party say , or rather hint , that religion be only good as a check on the more barbarous portion of the population ; and Oblonsky really could not stand through even a short church service without pain in his foot , nor understand why one should use all that dreadful high - fly language about another world while one can live so merrily in this one . besides , Oblonsky be fond of a pleasant joke , and sometimes like to perplex a simple - minded man by observe that if you be go to be proud of your ancestry , why stop short at Prince Rurik and repudiate your old ancestor – the ape ?
thus Liberalism become habitual to Oblonsky , and he love his paper as he love his after - dinner cigar , for the slight mistiness it produce in his brain .
he read the lead article , which explain that in our time it be needless to raise the cry that radicalism be threaten to swallow up all conservative element and to maintain that the government should take measure to crush the hydra of revolution ; for , on the contrary , ' in our opinion the danger lie not in an imaginary hydra of revolution but in an obstinate cling to tradition which hamper progress , ' etc .

OBLONSKY 'S NATURAL ability have helped HIM to do well at school , but mischief and laziness have cause he to finish very low in his year 's class . yet in spite of his dissipate life , his unimportant service rank , and his comparative youth , he occupy a distinguished and well - pay post as Head of one of the Government Boards in Moscow .
this post he have obtain through Alexis Alexandrovich Karenin , his sister Anna 's husband , who hold one of the most important position in the Ministry to which that Moscow Board belong . but even if Karenin have not nominate his brother - in - law for that post , Steve Oblonsky , through one of a hundred other person – brother , sister , relation , cousin , uncle or aunt – would have obtain this or a similar post with a salary of some 6000 rouble a year , which he need because in spite of his wife 's substantial mean his affair be in a bad way .
half Moscow and half Petersburg be his relation or friend . he be bear among those who be or who become the great one of this world .
one third of the official world , the old man , be his father 's friend and have know he in petticoat , he be on intimate term with another third , and be well acquaint with the last third .
consequently the distributor of earthly blessing , such as government post , grant , concession , and the like , be all his friend . they could not overlook one who belong to they , so that Oblonsky have no special difficulty in obtain a lucrative post ; he have only not to raise any objection , not to be envious , not to quarrel , and not to take offence – all thing which , be naturally good - tempered , he never do .

the question be the fashionable one , whether a definite line exist between psychological and physiological phenomenon in human activity ; and if so , where it lie ?

VRONSKY have never KNOWN FAMILY LIFE .
his mother in her youth have be a brilliant Society woman , and during her married life and especially in her widowhood have have many love affair , know to everybody .
he hardly remember his father , and have be educate in the Cadet Corps .

though he occasionally go into the high Petersburg Society , all his love interest lie outside it .
in Moscow , after this luxurious course of Petersburg life , he experience for the first time the delight of intimacy with a sweet , innocent Society girl who fall in love with he .
it never enter his head that there could be any wrong in his relation with Kitty .
at ball he dance chiefly with she and he visit she at her home .
he talk with she the usual Society talk : all sort of rubbish , but rubbish into which involuntarily he put a special meaning for she .
though he never say anything to she which could not have be say before everybody he be conscious that she be become more and more dependent upon he , and the more he feel this the pleasanter it be , and the more tender become his feeling toward she .
he do not know that his behaviour toward Kitty have a name of its own , that it be decoy a girl with no intention of marry she , and be one of the evil action common among brilliant young man like himself .
he think he be the first to discover this pleasure and he enjoy his discovery .
if he could have hear what her parent say that night , if he could have know her family 's point of view and learn that Kitty would be unhappy if he do not marry she , he would have be much surprised and would not have believe it .
he would not have believe that what give so much and such excellent pleasure to he , and – what be more – to she , could be wrong .
every less could he have believe that he ought to marry .
marriage have never present itself to he as a possibility .
not only do he dislike family life , but in accordance with the view generally hold in the bachelor world in which he live he regard the family , and especially a husband , as something alien , hostile , and above all ridiculous .
but although Vronsky have no suspicion of what Kitty 's parent be say , he feel , as he leave the Shcherbatskys ' house that night , that the secret spiritual bond which exist between he and Kitty have so strengthen during the evening that some action ought to be take . but what this should or could be he could not imagine .

those dear love eye ! when she say , " and very much . "
' well , and what of it ?
nothing , of course .

he pass in review the place he might go to .
' the Club : a game of bezique , a bottle of champagne with Ignatev ?
no , I will not go there .
Chateau des Fleurs ? there I should find Oblonsky , french couplet , the cancan .
no , I be sick of it .

' come , Anna Arkadyevna , ' begin Korsunsky , draw her bare arm under his , ' I have such a good idea for a cotillion – Un bijou . '
and he move slowly on , try to draw she with he .
their host smile approvingly .

' no , as it be I have dance more in Moscow at your one ball than I dance the whole winter in Petersburg , ' say Anna , look round at Vronsky who stand beside she . ' I must rest before my journey . '

' yes , there be certainly something objectionable and repellent about I , ' think Levin after leave the Shcherbatskys , as he walk toward his brother 's lodging . ' I do not get on with other people .
they say it be pride !
no , I be not even proud .
if I have any pride , I should not have put myself into such a position . '
and he picture to himself Vronsky , happy , kind , clever , calm , and certainly never place himself in such a terrible position as he , Levin , have be in that evening .
' yes , she be bind to choose he .
it have to be so , and I have no cause to complain of anyone or anything .
it be my own fault .
what right have I to imagine that she would wish to unite her life with mine ?
who and what be I ?
a man of no account , want by no one and of no use to anyone . '

he recall how despite the ridicule of his fellow - student his brother have live like a monk while at the University and for a year after , strictly observe all the religious rite , attend service , fast , avoid all pleasure and especially woman ; and then how he suddenly break loose , become intimate with the vile people and give himself up to unbridled debauchery .
he remember how his brother have bring a boy from the country to educate , and in a fit of anger have so beat the lad that proceeding be commence against he for cause bodily harm .
he remember an affair with a sharp to whom his brother have lose money , and whom he have first give a promissory note and then prosecute on a charge of fraud .
( that be when his brother Sergius have pay the money for he . )

it be all very disgusting , but to Levin it do not seem nearly so disgusting as it must have seem to those who do not know Nicholas , nor his whole story , nor his heart .

he be tease and call ' noah ' and ' monk , ' and then when he break loose no one help he , but all turn away from he with horror and disgust .

it be not his fault that he be bear with his ungovernable temper , and with a cramped mind .
he always wish to do right .
' I will tell he everything , I will get he to tell I everything . I will show he that I love and therefore understand he , ' Levin decide in his mind , as toward eleven o'clock he drive up to the hotel of which he have the address .
' Upstairs , Nos . I2 and I3 , ' say the hall porter in reply to Levin 's question .
' be he in ? '
' I expect so . '
the door of No . I2 be ajar , and from within , visible in the streak of light , issue dense fume of inferior and weak tobacco . Levin hear a stranger 's voice , but know at once that his brother be there , for he hear he cough .

' it all depend on how intelligently and rationally the affair be conduct . '

no , wait a little .

' well , Masha , order supper for three , with vodka and wine ...
no , wait .
no , never mind ...
you may go . '
' so you see ... ' NICHOLAS LEVIN continued with an effort , wrinkle his brow and twitching .
he evidently find it hard to decide what to say and to do . ' do you see ... ' he point to a bundle of iron rod tie together with string , in a corner of the room .

all the profit on their labour , by which they might better their condition , give themselves some leisure , and consequently gain some education , all this surplus value be take away by the capitalist .
and our society have so shape itself that the more the people work the rich the merchant and landowner will become , while the people will remain beast of burden for ever .

you despise it , well , that be all right – then go away . go , go in God 's name ! ' he exclaim , rise from his chair .

and he begin to relate all his encounter with these new institution .

NEXT MORNING CONSTANTINE LEVIN LEFT MOSCOW and toward evening he reach home .
on his way back in the train he talk with his fellow - passenger about politic and the new railway , and feel oppress , just as in Moscow , by the confusion of the view express , by discontent with himself and a vague sense of shame . but when he get out of the train at his station and by the dim light from the station window see his one - eyed coachman , Ignat , with his coat - collar turn up , and his sledge with its carpet - line back , his horse with their tie - up tail , and the harness with its ring and tassel , and when Ignat , while still put the luggage into the sledge , begin tell he the village news : how the contractor have come , and Pava have calve , – Levin feel that the confusion be begin to clear away and his shame and self - dissatisfaction to pass .
he feel this at the mere sight of Ignat and the horse ; but when he have put on the sheepskin coat that have be bring for he and , well wrap up , have seat himself in the sledge and start homeward , turn over in his mind the order he would give about the work on the estate , and as he watch the side horse ( once a saddle - horse that have be overridden , a spirited animal from the Don ) , he see what have befall he in quite a different light .
he feel that he be himself and do not wish to be anyone else .
he only wish now to be well than he have be formerly .
first of all he decide that he would no long hope for the exceptional happiness which marriage be to have give he , and consequently he would not underrate the present as he have do .
secondly , he would never again allow himself to be carry away by passion , the repulsive memory of which have so torment he when he be make up his mind to propose .
then , remember his brother Nicholas , he determine that he would never allow himself to forget he again , but would watch over he , keep he in sight , and be ready to help when thing go hard with he .
and he feel that that would be soon .
then his brother 's talk about communism , which he have take lightly at the time , now make he think .
he consider an entire change of economic condition nonsense ; but he have always feel the injustice of his superfluity compare with the peasant 's poverty , and now decide , in order to feel himself quite justified , that though he have always work hard and live simply , he would in future work still more and allow himself still less luxury .
and it all seem to he so easy to carry out that he be in a pleasant reverie the whole way home , and it be with cheerful hope for a new and well life that he reach his house toward nine o'clock in the evening .
a light fall on the snow - cover space in front of the house from the window of the room of his old nurse Agatha Mikhaylovna , who now act as his housekeeper .
she have not yet go to bed , and Kuzma , whom she have rouse , come run out barefoot and still half - asleep into the porch .
Laska , a setter bitch , run out too , almost throw Kuzma off his foot , and whine and rub herself against Levin 's knee , jump up and wish but not dare to put her front paw on his chest .
' you have soon come back , sir , ' say Agatha Mikhaylovna .
' I be home - sick , Agatha Mikhaylovna .
visiting be all very well , but " there be no place like home,"- ' he reply , and go into his study .
a candle just bring in gradually light up the study and its familiar detail become visible : the stag 's horn , the book shelf , the look - glass , the hot - air aperture of the stove with its brass lid , which have long be in need of repair , his father 's couch , the large table on which be an open volume , a broken ash - tray , and an exercise - book in his handwriting .
when he see all this , he be overcome by a momentary doubt of the possibility of start the new life of which he have be dream on his way .
all these trace of his old life seem to seize hold of he and say , ' no , you will not escape we and will not be different , but will remain such as you have be : full of doubt ; full of dissatisfaction with yourself , and of vain attempt at improvement follow by failure , and continual hope of the happiness which have escape you and be impossible for you . '
that be what the thing say , but another voice within his soul be say that one must not submit to the past and that one can do anything with oneself .
and obey the latter voice he go to the corner where two thirty - six pound dumb - bell lay and begin do gymnastic exercise with they to invigorate himself .
he hear a creaking of step at the door and hurriedly put down the dumb - bell .
his steward enter and say that , ' the Lord be thank , ' everything be all right , but that the buckwheat have burn in the new drying kiln .
this news irritate Levin .
the new kiln have be build and partly invent by he .
the steward have always be against the new kiln , and now proclaim with suppress triumph that the buckwheat have got burn .
Levin feel quite certain that if it have be burn it be only because the precaution about which he have give instruction over and over again have be neglect .
he be vex , and he reprimand the steward .
but the steward have one important and pleasant event to report . Pava , his good and most valuable cow , buy at the cattle - show , have calve .
' Kuzma , bring I my sheep - skin .
and you tell they to bring a lantern . I will go and have a look at she , ' he say to the steward .
the shed where the most valuable cattle be keep be just behind the house .
cross the yard past the heap of snow by the lilac bush , he reach the shed .
there be a warm steaming smell of manure when the frozen door open , and the cow , astonish at the unaccustomed light of the lantern , begin move on their clean straw .
Levin see the broad smooth black - mottled back of a dutch cow .
the bull , Berkut , with a ring through his nose , be lie down , and almost rise up , but change his mind and only snort a couple of time as they pass by . the red beauty Pava , enormous as a hippopotamus , turn she back ,
hide her calf from the newcomer and sniff at it . Levin enter the stall and examine Pava , who , become excited , be about to low , but quiet down when Levin move the calf toward she , and sigh heavily begin lick it with her rough tongue .
the calf fumble about , push its nose under its mother 's belly and swinge its little tail .
' show a light here , Theodore , here , ' say Levin , examine the calf .
' like its mother , ' he say , ' although the colour be its father 's ; very fine , big - boned and deep - flank .
Vasily Fedorich , be not she fine ? ' he say , turn to the steward , and quite forgive he for the buckwheat under the influence of his satisfaction about the calf .
' whom could she take after , not to be good ?
Simon the contractor , come the day after you leave .
we shall have to employ he , Constantine Dmitrich , ' say the steward . ' I tell you about the machine . '
this one question lead Levin back to all the detail of his farming , which be on a large and elaborate scale . he go straight from the cow - shed to the office , and after talk thing over with the steward and with Simon the contractor , he return to the house and go directly upstairs to the drawing - room .
it be a large OLD - FASHIONED HOUSE , and though only Levin be live in it , he use and heat the whole of it .
he know this to be foolish and even wrong , and contrary to his new plan , but this house be a whole world to Levin .
it be the world in which his father and mother have live and die .
they have live a life which appear to he ideally perfect , and which he have dream of renew with a wife and family of his own .
Levin could scarcely remember his mother .
his conception of she be to he a sacred memory , and in his imagination his future wife be to be a repetition of the enchanting and holy ideal of womanhood that his mother have be .
he could not imagine the love of woman without marriage , and even picture to himself a family first and then the woman who would give he the family .
his view on marriage therefore do not resemble those of most of his acquaintance , for whom marriage be only one of many social affair ; for Levin it be the chief thing in life , on which the whole happiness of life depend .
and now he have to renounce it .
when he have settle in the arm - chair in the little drawing room where he always have his tea , and Agatha Mikhaylovna have bring it in for he and have sit down at the window with her usual remark , ' I will sit down sir ! ' he feel that , strange to say , he have not really forget his dream and that he could not live without they .
with she , or with another , they would come true .
he read his book , and follow what he read , stop now and then to listen to Agatha Mikhaylovna , who chatter indefatigably ; and at the same time various picture of farming and future family life arise disconnectedly in his mind .
he feel that in the depth of his soul something be settle down , adjust and compose itself .
he listen to Agatha Mikhaylovna 's talk of how Prokhor have forget the Lord , be spend on drink the money Levin have give he to buy a horse with , and have beat his wife nearly to death ; he listen and read , and remember the whole sequence of thought raise by what he be read .
it be a book of Tyndall 's on heat .
he recall his disapproval of Tyndall 's self - conceit concern the cleverness of his experiment and his lack of a philosophic outlook .
and suddenly the joyous thought come uppermost : ' in two year ' time I shall have two dutch cow in my herd and Pava herself may still be alive ; there will be twelve cow by Berkut , and these three to crown all – splendid ! '
he return to his book .
' well , let we grant that electricity and heat be one and the same , but can we substitute the one quantity for the other in solve an equation ?
then what of it ?
the connection between all the force of nature can be feel instinctively without all that ...
it will be especially good when Pava 's calf be already a red - mottled cow , and the whole herd in which these three will be ... !
splendid !
to go out with my wife and the visitor and meet the herd ...
my wife will say : " we , Constantine and I , rear this calf like a baby . "
" how can you be interested in these thing ? " the visitor will ask .
" all that interest he interest I .. "
but who be she ? ' and he remember what have happen in Moscow .
' well , what be to be do ? ...
it be not my fault .
but now everything will be on new line .
it be nonsense to say that life will prevent it , that the past prevent it .
I must struggle to live a well , a far well , life . '
he lift his head and ponder .
Old Laska , who have not yet quite digest her joy at her master 's return and have run out to bark in the yard , now come back , bring a smell of fresh air with she into the room and , wag her tail , she approach he and put her head under his hand whine plaintively , ask to be pat .
' she all but speak , ' say Agatha Mikhaylovna .
' she be only a dog , but she understand that her master have come back feel depressed . '
' why depressed ? '
' oh , do not I see ?
I ought to understand gentlefolk by this time .
I have grow up among they from a child .
never mind , my dear , as long as you have good health and a clean conscience ! '
Levin look at she intently , surprise that she know so well what be in his mind .
' shall I bring you a little more tea ? ' she say and go out with his cup .
Laska keep on push her head under his hand .
he pat she a little , and she curl herself up at his foot with her head on her outstretched hind paw .
and to show that all be now well and satisfactory , she slightly open her mouth , smack her sticky lip , and draw they more closely over her old tooth lie still in blissful peace .
Levin attentively watch this last movement of hers .
' and it be just the same with I ! ' he say to himself . ' it be just the same with I .
what do it matter ...

PART II

the highest petersburg SOCIETY be really all one : all who belong to it know and even visit one another .
but this large circle have its subdivision .
Anna Arkadyevna Karenina have friend and close connection in three different set .
one of these be her husband 's official set , consist of his colleague and subordinate , who in most varied and capricious way be connect and separate by social condition .
Anna find it hard now to recall the feeling of almost religious respect she have at first feel for these people .
now she know they all as well as the inhabitant of a provincial town know one another ; she know the habit and weakness of each of they , and where the shoe pinch this or that foot ; she know their relation to one another and to the governing centre ; she know who side with whom , and how and by what means each support himself , and who agree or disagree with whom and about what ; but ( in spite of admonition and advice from the Countess Lydia Ivanovna ) this bureaucratic circle of male interest could not interest Anna , and she avoid it .

the centre of that circle be the Countess Lydia Ivanovna .
it consist of elderly , plain , philanthropic and pious woman and clever , well - educate , ambitious man .

Karenin set great value on this circle , and Anna , who know how to get on with every one , have during the first part of her life in Petersburg make friend in it too .

it seem to she that she , and all of they , be only pretend , and she feel so bored and uncomfortable in that Society that she visit Lydia Ivanovna as rarely as possible .

when LEVIN FIRST RETURNED from MOSCOW , and while he still start and blush every time he remember the disgrace of the refusal , he have say to himself , ' I blush and start like this when I be plough in physics and have to remain in the second class ; and in the same way I feel myself lose when I make a mess of my sister 's affair that have be entrust to I .
and what happen ?
now that year have pass , when I remember it , I be surprised that it could have grieve I so much .
so it will be with this grief .
time will pass , and I shall become indifferent . '
but three month pass and he have not become indifferent to it , and to think of it still hurt he as it have do in the first day .
he could not find peace , because he have so long dream of family life and feel so ripe for it , but be still unmarried and far than ever from marriage .
he himself feel painfully what all those around he feel too , that it be not good for a man of his age to be alone .
he remember how , just before leave for Moscow , he have say to Nicholas , his cowman , a naive peasant with whom he like to talk : ' well , Nicholas , I want to get marry , ' and how Nicholas have promptly reply , as on a matter about which there could be no doubt : ' and it be high time , Constantine Dmitrich . '
but now he be furth from marriage than ever .
the place be unoccupied , and when in imagination he try to put one of the girl he know there , he feel that it be quite impossible .
moreover , the memory of her refusal , and the part he have play in it , torment he with shame .
however much he tell himself that he be not at all to blame in that matter , the memory of it , together with other shameful memory , make he start and blush .
there have be in his past , as in that of every man , action which he realize be bad , and for which his conscience ought to have torment he : but the recollection of those bad action do not torment he nearly as much as these trivial yet shameful memory .
these wound never close up .
and among these recollection stand the memory of her refusal and the pitiful role he must have play in the eye of the other that evening .
but time and work tell .
the painful memory become more and more covered over by the commonplace but important event of country life .
every week he think less and less about Kitty .
he wait impatiently to hear that she be marry or be getting marry soon , hope that such news , like the drawing of an ache tooth , would quite cure he .
meanwhile spring have come , a glorious steady spring , without the expectation and disappointment spring usually bring . it be one of these rare spring which plant , animal , and man alike rejoice in .
this lovely spring rouse Levin still more and confirm he in the determination completely to renounce the past in order to fashion his solitary life firmly and independently .
though he have not carry out many of the plan with which he have return to the country from Moscow , he have hold to the most important one , that of live a pure life , and he be not experience the shame which use to torment he when he have fall , but be able to look people boldly in the face .
already in February he have receive a letter from Mary Nikolavna to say that his brother Nicholas 's health be get bad , but that he would not submit to any treatment . in consequence of this news Levin go to Moscow , see his brother , and manage to persuade he to consult a doctor and go to a watering - place abroad .
he be so successful in persuade his brother , and in lend he money for the journey without irritate he , that he be satisfied with himself in this respect .
besides his agricultural pursuit , which require special attention in spring , and besides reading , Levin have another occupation . he have that winter begin write a book on agriculture , the basis of which be that the character of the labourer be treat as a definite factor , like climate and soil , and that therefore the conclusion of agricultural science should be deduce not from datum supply by climate and soil only , but from datum of climate , soil , and the immutable character of the labourer .
so that in spite of his solitary life , or rather because of it , his time be completely fill up ; only occasionally he feel an unsatisfied desire to share with some one besides Agatha Mikhaylovna the thought that wander through his brain – for even with she he often discuss physics , agricultural theory , and especially philosophy , which last be her favourite subject .
the spring have set in late .
during the last week of lent the weather have be clear and frosty .
it thaw in the sunshine by day , but at night the thermometer go down to sixteen degree Fahrenheit . the snow be cover with a crust of ice so thick that cart could pass even where there be no road .
Easter find snow still on the ground ; but on Easter Monday a warm wind begin to blow , the cloud gather , and for three day and night warm stormy rain pour down .
on the Thursday the wind fall and a thick grey mist rise as if to hide the secret of the change nature be carry on .
beneath the mist the snow - water rush down , the ice on the river crack and move , and the turbid , foam torrent flow quick , till on the first Sunday after Easter toward evening the mist dissolve , the cloud break into fleecy cloudlet and disperse , the sky clear , and real spring be there .
in the morning the bright rise sun quickly melt the thin ice on the water and the warm air all around vibrate with the vapour give off by the awaken earth .
last year 's grass grow green again and new blade come up like needle - point , bud swell on the guelder - rise and currant bush and on the sticky , spicy birch tree , and among the golden catkin and on the willow branch the bee begin to hum .
the unseen lark burst into song above the velvety fresh green and the frozen stubble , the peewit begin to cry above the water bring down by the storm and still flood the low - lie place and marsh , and high up the crane and goose fly , utter their spring call .
the cattle , who have lose all but a few patch of their winter coat , begin to low in the meadow ; the crooked - legged lamb begin to play round their bleat mother , who be lose their wool ; swift - footed child begin to run along the quickly - dry path mark with imprint of bare foot , the merry voice of woman who be bleach their linen begin to chatter by the pond , and the axis of peasant , get ready their wooden plough and harrow , click in the yard .
the real spring have come .
LEVIN PUT on his high boots and , for the first time , a cloth coat instead of a fur , and go out to attend to his farm . step now on a piece of ice , now into the sticky mud , he cross the stream of dazzling water .
spring be the time for make plan and resolution , and Levin , like a tree which in the spring - time do not yet know in which direction and in what manner its young shoot and twig ( still imprison in their bud ) will develop , do not quite know what work on his beloved land he be go to take in hand , but he feel that his mind be full of the fine plan and resolution .
first of all he go to the cattle - yard .
the cow have be let out there , and , warm by the sunshine , their glossy new coat glisten , they be low to be let out into the field .
after he have for a while admire his cow , all familiar to he to the minute detail , Levin give order for they to be drive into the field and for the calf to be let out into the yard .
the cowherd run away merrily to get ready .
the dairymaids , with twig in their hand , hold their skirt up over their bare white leg , not yet sun - burn , splash through the puddle into the yard , drive the calf , who be mad with the joy of spring .
having gaze with admiration at the exceptionally fine calf bear that year – the old one be as big as peasant ' cow , and Pava 's three - month - old calf be as big as a yearling – Levin give order to bring a trough of food for they and to put some hay into the rack outside .
but it turn out that the rack , which have be put up in autumn in the yard and not use during winter , be break .
he send for the carpenter , who be under contract to be with the threshing - machine , but it turn out that he be mend the harrow , which should have be mend the week before Lent .
this be very annoying to Levin .
it be vex that the careless farm management , against which he have struggle so many year with all his might , still continue .
he find out that the rack which be not want in winter have be take into the farm - horse ' stable , and there have got break , as they be lightly make , be mean only for the calf .
besides this , it prove that the harrow and all the agricultural implement which he have order to be examine and mend in winter , for which purpose three carpenter have be specially engage , have not be see to , and that the harrow be now be mend when it be time to start harrowing .
Levin send for the steward , but instead of wait go at once to look for he himself .
the steward , in his astrakhan - trim coat , as radiant as everything else that day , be come from the threshing - ground breaking a bit of straw in his hand .
' why be the carpenter not with the threshing - machine ? '
' oh , I mean to tell you yesterday that the harrow need mend .
it be time to plough , you know . '

' I have give order for they to be put into their place .

' it will be possible , beyond Turkino , to - morrow or the day after . '

' there be no one to do it .
what be you to do with such people ?
three have not come .
and now Simon ... '

' cart manure must be start early so that it should be over before the first hay harvest , and the far field will have to be plough continually so as to keep the earth clean .

nothing grieve Levin so much as this manner , but it be a manner common to all the numerous steward he have employ .
they all take up the same attitude toward his plan , and therefore he now no long grow angry with they , but he be grieve , feel all the more stimulate to resist this , so to say , elemental force for which he could find no other name but ' as God will , ' which always obstruct he .

and Levin ride across the muddy yard and out of the gate into the field at a brisk amble , his fresh little horse snort at the puddle and pull at the bridle .
if he have feel light - hearted in the cattle and farm yard , he feel still more so in the field .

when he have pass the forest , a vast expanse of velvety green unroll before he without a single bare spot , and only sprinkle here and there in the hollow with patch of unmelted snow .

' ' we must plough first , Constantine Dmitrich , ' say Ipat .
the far he go the happy he feel and all sort of plan for his estate , each well than the last , present themselves to he : to plant row of willow with a southern aspect on all the field , so that the snow should not remain long under they ; to divide the field , till six and keep three under grass ; to build a new cattle - yard at the further end of the field , to dig a pond , and to make fold for the cattle for manuring purpose .
then he would have three hundred desyatina of wheat , one hundred of potato , and one hundred and fifty of clover , and not a single desyatina exhausted .
dream such dream , carefully guide his horse so as not to trample down his young growth , he ride up to the labourer who be sow the clover .

the earth in the cart with which the seed be mixed be not rub fine , but be press or freeze into lump .

this be not right , but Levin seldom get angry with the hire man .

you drag half a hundredweight on your boot . '

as LEVIN , in the HIGHEST spirit , be near the house he hear the sound of a tinkle bell approach the main entrance .

but he be ashamed of that feeling , and immediately , as it be , open out his spiritual arm and with tender joy expect , and now hope with his whole soul , that it be his brother .
he touch up his horse and , having pass the acacia tree , see a hire three - horse sledge come from the station and in it a gentleman in a fur coat .

the PLACE where they be go to SHOOT be not far away , by a stream among young aspen tree .
when they have reach the wood Levin get down and lead Oblonsky to the corner of a mossy and marshy glade , already free from snow .

the old grey - haired Laska , follow close on his heel , sit down warily in front of he and prick up her ear .
the sun be set behind the forest , and the little birch intersperse among the aspen tree stand out clearly against the evening glow with their droop branch and their swollen bud ready to burst into leaf .
from the thicket , where the snow have not all melt , the water still flow in branching streamlet with a gentle ripple sound .

' just fancy !

Oblonsky 's figure again disappear behind the bush , and Levin only see the flare of a match , follow by the red glow of a cigarette and a spiral of blue smoke .

' and what be that scream ? ' he ask , draw Levin 's attention to a long - draw cry like the high - pitch whinny of a colt in play .
' do not you know ?
it be a male hare .
but stop talk !

they hear a shrill whistle in the distance , and after the two second ' interval so familiar to sportsman , another follow , and then a third , and after the third whistle come a cry .

' can I have miss ? ' cry Oblonsky , who could not see through the smoke . ' here it be ! ' answer Levin , point to Laska , who with one ear erect , wag her fluffy , high - arch tail , step slowly as if to prolong the pleasure and seem almost to smile , bring the dead bird to her master . it begin to get dark .

' as you please . '

ON their way HOME Levin inquire the particular of Kitty 's illness and of the Shcherbatskys ' plan , and though he would have be ashamed to confess it , what he hear be agreeable to he .

THOUGH VRONSKY 's whole INNER life be absorb by his passion , his external life run unalterably and inevitably along its former customary rail of social and regimental connection and interest .
the interest of the regiment occupy an important place in his life , because he be fond of his regiment and still more because the regiment be fond of he .
not only be they fond of he , they respect he too and be proud of he : proud that this man , with his enormous wealth and excellent education and ability , to whom the road to success of all kind gratify to ambition or vanity lie open , have disregard all this , and of all life 's interest have near to his heart those of his regiment and his comrade .
Vronsky be aware of this attitude of his comrade toward he , and besides like the life feel bind to justify their view of he .
it go without say that he speak to none of they about his love , nor do he betray himself even in the wild drinking - bout ( indeed , he never drink so as to lose all self - control ) . and he silence any of his thoughtless comrade who try to hint at the liaison .
but in spite of this , his love affair be know to all the town : everybody guess more or less correctly what his relation with Anna Karenina be . Most of the young man envy he just on account of what be most try in the affair , namely Karenin 's high rank and the consequent prominence of the affair in Society .
the majority of young woman , who envy Anna and have long be weary of hear her virtue praise , be pleased at what they guess , and only wait to be sure that public opinion have turn before throw the whole weight of their scorn at she .
they already prepare lump of mud to pelt she with in due time .
Most of the old people and of those highly - place regret this impend social scandal .
Vronsky 's mother , on hearing of the matter , be at first pleased , both because in her opinion nothing give such finish touch to a brilliant young man as an intrigue in the good Society , and also because this Anna Karenina , who have so take her fancy and who have talk so much about her little son , be after all such as the Countess Vronsky expect all handsome and well - breed woman to be .
but latterly she have hear that her son have refuse a post of importance for his career , merely to remain with his regiment and be able to see Anna Karenina , and that exalted person be dissatisfied with he for it , so she change her opinion .
she be also displeased because , from all she hear of it , this affair be not one of those brilliant , graceful , Society liaison which she approve , but a desperate Werther - like passion which might lead he into do something foolish .
she have not see he since his sudden departure from Moscow , and through her eld son she send he word to come and see she .
the eld brother be also dissatisfied with the young .
he do not distinguish what kind of love it be , great or small , passionate or passionless , guilty or pure ( he himself , the father of a family , keep a ballet girl , and be therefore lenient in these matter ): but he know that it be a love affair which displease those whom it be necessary to please , and he therefore disapprove of his brother 's conduct .
besides his military and social interest Vronsky have another one , namely horse , of which he be passionately fond .
that year there be to be an officer ' steeplechase , and Vronsky have put down his name , buy an english thoroughbred mare , and , in spite of his love , be passionately , though restrainedly , concern about the come race .
the two passion do not interfere with one another .
on the contrary he need an occupation and an interest apart from his love , in which to refresh himself and find rest from the impression which agitate he too violently .
ON the day of the KRASNOE SELO RACES Vronsky come early than usual to the regimental mess - room to eat his beefsteak .
it be not necessary for he to train very strictly as his weight be just the regulation eleven - and - a - half stone , but he have to be careful not to get fat and therefore avoid sweet and starchy food .

EXTERNALLY KARENIN 's relation with his wife remain as before .
the only difference be that he be even more occupied than before .
as in former year , at the beginning of the spring he go abroad to recuperate his health , which be upset each year by the winter 's work . and as usual he return in July and at once with increase energy take up his customary work .
and as usual his wife have move to the country house while he remain in Petersburg .
since their conversation on the night of the Princess Tverskaya 's party he have never speak to Anna of his suspicion and jealousy , and that habitual tone of his which seem to mock at some one be exactly suited to his present relation with she .
he be rather cold toward she .
he appear only to be slightly dissatisfied with she for that first night 's talk which she have evade .
in his behaviour to she there be a shade of vexation , but nothing more .
' you do not wish to have an explanation , ' he seem to say to she in imagination , ' so much the bad for you .
now you will ask I to explain . and I shall not do so .
so much the bad for you , ' he think , like a man who having vainly try to extinguish a fire should be vex at his vain exertion and say to it : ' well , go on and burn , it be your own fault . '
he who be so wise and astute in official affair do not realize the insanity of such an attitude toward his wife .
he do not understand it because it would have be too terrible to realize his real situation , and he have close , locked , and seal that compartment of his soul which contain his feeling for his family – that is , his wife and son .
he who have be a considerate father , since the end of that winter have become particularly cold toward his son , and treat he in the same bantering manner as he do his wife .
' ah , young man ! ' be the way in which he address he .
Karenin think and say that in no previous year have he have so much official business as this year ; but he be not conscious of the fact that this year he invent work for himself , and that this be one of the mean of keep that compartment close where lay his feeling for and thought of his family , which become more terrible the long they lie there .
if anyone have venture to ask he what he think of his wife 's conduct , the mild and gentle Karenin would not have give any answer , but would have be angry with the man who put such a question .
that be why Karenin 's face bear a stern , proud expression when anyone ask about his wife 's health .
he do not wish to think about his wife 's conduct and feeling at all , and he really do not think about they .
the country house the Karenins regularly occupy in summer be in Peterhof , and generally the Countess Lydia Ivanovna also live near by and be in constant touch with Anna .
that year the Countess Lydia Ivanovna refuse to live in Peterhof , do not once come to see Anna , and hint to Karenin the undesirability of Anna 's intimacy with Betsy and Vronsky .
Karenin stop she severely , express the opinion that his wife be above suspicion , and from that time begin to avoid the Countess .
he do not wish to see , and do not see , that many people in Society already look askance at Anna ; he do not wish to understand , and do not understand , why his wife particularly insist on move to Tsarskoe Selo , where Betsy live and near which place Vronsky 's regiment be station .
he do not let himself think about this and do not think about it , yet at the bottom of his soul , without admit it to himself or have any proof or even suspicion of it , he nevertheless know certainly that he be a wrong husband , and be therefore profoundly unhappy .
how often during the eight year of happy married life with his wife , when he see other who be unfaithful wife or deceive husband , have Karenin say to himself , ' how could they let it come to that ? how be it they do not end such a hideous state of thing ? '
but now , when the misfortune have fall on his own head , he not only do not think of how to end it , but do not wish to recognize it at all – and do not wish to recognize it just because it be too terrible , too unnatural .
since his return from abroad Karenin have be twice at the country house .
once he dine there , and the other time he spend an evening with some visitor , but he have not once stay the night , as he use to do in former year .
the day of the race be a very busy one for Karenin ; but in the morning when he make his plan for the day he decide that immediately after an early dinner he would go to see his wife at the country house , and from there to the race , at which the whole Court would be present and where he ought to appear .
he would call on his wife , because he have decide to do so once a week for the sake of propriety .
besides , he have that day to give her money for her expense , due accord to their custom by the fifteenth of each month .
have with the mental control habitual to he consider these matter concern his wife , he do not allow his thought to run on far about she .
he have a very busy morning .
on the previous day the Countess Lydia Ivanovna have send he a pamphlet by a celebrated traveller in China , and a letter ask he to receive this traveller , who for various reason be very interesting and necessary to they .
Karenin have not have time to finish the pamphlet the evening before , and do so in the morning .
then he receive petitioner , hear report , give audience , assign post and order dismissal , apportion reward , pension , and salary , and attend to correspondence – everyday matter , as he call they , which take up so much of his time .
after that come personal matter – a visit from his doctor and one from his steward .
the latter do not keep he long .
he only hand Karenin the money he want and give he a short account of the state of his affair , which be not quite satisfactory , for it happen that , owe to their having be from home a good deal , more have be spend that year than usual and there be a deficit .
but the doctor , a celebrated Petersburg physician who be on friendly term with Karenin , take up a good deal of time .
Karenin have not expect he to - day and be surprised to see he , and yet more surprised that the doctor question he very particularly about his state of health , sound his chest and tap and feel his liver .

' do it for my sake , ' the Countess Lydia Ivanovna have say .
' I will do it for the sake of Russia , Countess , ' reply the doctor .

he find he insufficiently nourish and his liver much enlarge , and that the water have have no effect at all .

' I be very glad you have be to see he , ' say Slyudin . ' he be not well , and I believe that ...
well , what be it ? '
' it be this , ' say the doctor , beckon over Slyudin 's head to his coachman to drive up . ' it be this , ' and with his white hand he take a finger of his kid glove and stretch it ; ' if you try to break a cord that be slack it be not easy to break it , but strain that cord to its utmost and the weight of a finger will snap it . and he by his hard work and the conscientious way he do it , be strained to the utmost , and there be a pressure from outside , and a heavy one , ' conclude the doctor , raise his eyebrow significantly . ' will you be at the race ? ' he add , descend the step to his brougham . ' yes , yes , of course it take a lot of time , ' he reply to some remark of Slyudin ' which he have not quite catch .
after the doctor , who have take up so much time , come the famous traveller , and Karenin , thank to the pamphlet he have just read and to what he know before , greatly impress the traveller by the depth of his knowledge of the subject and the breadth of his enlighten outlook .
at the same time as the traveller , a provincial Marshal of the Nobility be announce with whom Karenin have some thing to talk over .

he only manage to get back at five , his dinner - time , and having dine with his private secretary , he invite the latter to drive with he to his country house and to go to the race with he .
without acknowledge it to himself , Karenin now look out for opportunity of have a third person present at his interview with his wife .
ANNA be UPSTAIRS stand in front of a mirror pinning , with Annushka 's help , a last bow to her dress , when she hear the wheel of a carriage grate on the gravel at the entrance .

as always happens where people congregate , the usual crystallization , if we may so call it , of Society take place in the little german watering - place to which the Shcherbatskys have come , assign to each person a definite and fix position .
as definitely and inevitably as a particle of water expose to the cold assume the well - know form of a snow crystal , do each new - comer on his arrival at the watering - place immediately settle into his natural position .
' Fürst Shcherbatsky sammt Gemahlin und Tochter , ' [ Prince Shcherbatsky with his wife and daughter . ] by the premise they occupy , by their name , and by the people they be acquaint with , at once crystallize into their definite and preordain place .
there be a real German Fürstin [ Princess ] at the watering - place that season , and consequently the crystallize process be accomplish with special energy .
Princess Shcherbatskaya particularly wish to introduce her daughter to the German Royal Princess , and on the second day after their arrival perform that rite .
Kitty make a low and graceful curtsy in her very simple dress – that be to say , very stylish summer gown order from Paris .
the Royal Princess say : ' I hope the rose will soon return to this pretty little face , ' and at once a definite path be firmly establish for the Shcherbatskys from which it be impossible to deviate .
they make acquaintance with the family of an English ' Lady , ' with a German Countess and her son who have be wound in the last war , with a swedish savant and with a Mr. Canut and his sister .
but the people with whom they necessarily associate most be a Moscow lady , Mary Evgenyevna Rtishcheva , and her daughter , whom Kitty find unpleasant because her illness be due to the same cause as Kitty 's – a love affair ; and a Moscow Colonel , whom Kitty from childhood have see and know in uniform with epaulette , and who here – with his small eye , low collar and coloured necktie – look indescribably comical , and be also wearisome because it be impossible to get rid of he .

she be not interested in the people she know , for she feel that nothing new would come from they .

it be a characteristic of Kitty 's always to expect to find the most excellent quality in people , especially in those she do not know .

among these people she be specially interested in a young russian girl who have come to the watering - place with an invalid russian lady , Madame Stahl , as every one call she .
Madame Stahl belong to the high Society , but she be so ill that she could not walk , and only on fine day occasionally appear on the promenade in a bath - chair .
but not so much from illness as from pride , as the Princess Shcherbatskaya explain – Madame Stahl be not acquaint with any of the Russians there .

she be like a beautiful flower which though not yet in full bloom be already begin to fade and have no scent .

KITTY also BECAME ACQUAINTED with Madame Stahl , and this acquaintanceship , together with Varenka 's friendship not only have a great influence on Kitty , but comfort she in her sorrow .

quite TOWARD the END of the season Prince Shcherbatsky , who from Carlsbad have go on to Baden and Kissingen to see some russian friend and to ' inhale some russian spirit , ' as he express it , return to his family .

' so it be well for you not to go ...
and , you understand , do not be hurt ... '
' it serve I right , it serve I right ! ' Kitty begin hurriedly , snatch Varenka 's sunshade out of her hand , and look past her friend 's eye .

' why – serve you right ?
I do not understand , ' she say .
' it serve I right because it be all pretence , all invent and not heartfelt .
what business have I with a stranger ?

because it be all pretence , pretence and pretence ! ... '
' but what motive have you for pretend ? ' say Varenka softly .
' oh , how stupid , how stupid !
there be no need at all ...
it be all pretence ! ' Kitty say , open and shut the sunshade .
' but with what object ? '
' to appear well than other to myself and to God – to deceive everybody .
no , I shall not give in to that again !
let I be bad , but at any rate not false , not a humbug ! '
' but who be a " humbug " ? ' ask Varenka reproachfully . ' you speak as if ... '
but Kitty be in one of her fit of passion .
she would not let Varenka finish .
' I be not talk about you , not about you at all .
you be perfection .
yes , yes , you be all perfection but how can I help it if I be bad ?
it would not have happen if I be not bad .
so let I be what I be , but not pretend .
what be Anna Pavlovna to I ?
let they live as they like , and I will live as I like .
I can not be different ...
and it be all not the thing , not the thing ! '
' but what be not the thing ? ' say Varenka , quite perplexed .
' it be all not the thing .

I have love you quite simply , but you , I expect , only in order to save I , to teach I . '
' you be unjust , ' say Varenka .
' but I be not talk about other , only about myself . '
' Kitty ! ' come her mother 's voice , ' come here and show Papa your coral . '
Kitty take from the table a little box which hold the coral , and with a proud look , without having make it up with her friend , go to where her mother be .
' what be the matter ?
why be you so red ? ' ask both her mother and father together .
' nothing , ' she say . ' I will come back in a minute , ' and run away .
' she be still here , ' think Kitty . ' what shall I say to she ?
oh dear ! what have I do , what have I say ?
why have I offend she ?
what be I to do ? what shall I say to she ? ' think Kitty and stop at the door .
Varenka , with her hat on , sit at the table examine the spring of her sunshade , which Kitty have break .
she look up .

peace be make .
but with her father 's return the world in which she have be live completely change for Kitty .

the doctor 's prediction be justify .
Kitty return to Russia quite cured !

PART III
SERGIUS IVANICH KOZNYSHEV , wish to take a rest from mental work , go to stay with his brother in the country instead of go abroad as usual .
accord to his view country life be preferable to any other , and he have now come to his brother 's house to enjoy it .
Constantine Levin be very pleased , especially as he no long expect his brother Nicholas to come that summer .
but in spite of his affection and respect for Koznyshev , Constantine do not feel at ease with his step - brother in the country .
to Constantine the country be the place where one live – that be to say , where one rejoice , suffer , and labour ; but to Koznyshev the country be , on the one hand , a place of rest from work , and on the other , a useful antidote to depravity , an antidote to which he resort with pleasure and with a consciousness of its utility .
to Constantine the country seem a good place because it be the scene of unquestionably useful labour ; to Koznyshev it seem good because one could and should do nothing there .
besides this , Koznyshev 's attitude toward the peasant jar on Constantine .
Koznyshev be will not to say that he know and love the common people : he often converse with peasant , and be able to do it well , frankly , and without affectation , deduce from every such conversation datum in the peasant ' favour and proof of his own knowledge of the people .
Constantine regard the peasant as the chief partner in a common undertaking , and despite his respect and the feeling of a blood - tie – probably , as he say , suck in with the milk of his peasant nurse – he as partner in their common undertaking , though often fill with admiration for the strength , meekness , and justice of these people , be very often ( when the business require other quality ) exasperate with they for their carelessness , untidiness , drunkenness , and untruthfulness .
have Constantine be ask whether he like the peasant , he would not have know what to answer .
he both like and dislike they , just as he like and dislike all human being .
with his natural kind heart he of course like human being more than he dislike they , and naturally the peasant be include ; but he could not like or dislike the people as if they be something apart , because he not only live among they , his interest closely bind up with theirs , but he consider himself one of the people and could not find in himself any special quality or defect which place he in contrast with they .
moreover , though he have long live in very close relation with the peasant , as their master , mediator , and above all as their adviser ( the peasant trust he , and would often come thirty mile to consult he ) , he have no definite opinion concern they . have he be ask whether he know the people , he would have be just as much at a loss for a reply as he be for a reply to the question whether he like they .
to say that he know the peasant be tantamount to say that he know human being .
he continually observe and learn to know all sort of human being , among they human being of the peasant class , whom he consider interesting , constantly discover in they new trait and alter his opinion accordingly .
Koznyshev , on the other hand , just as he praise country life as a contrast to the life he dislike , like the peasant as a contrast to the class he dislike and regard they as a contrast to humanity in general .
his methodical mind have form definite view on the life of the people , found partly on that life itself , but chiefly on its contrast .
he never alter his opinion about the people nor his sympathetic attitude toward they .
in the dispute which take place between the brother when discuss the peasant , Koznyshev be always victorious , just because he have definite view about they , their character , attribute , and taste ; while Constantine have no definite and fix view , and be often guilty of self - contradiction when argue on that subject .
Koznyshev think his young brother a splendid fellow , with his heart in the right place , but with a mind which , though rather quick , be sway by the impression of the moment and be therefore full of contradiction .
with an eld brother 's condescension he sometimes explain to he the meaning of thing , but could find no pleasure in discussion , because he could gain too easy a victory .
Constantine consider his brother to be a man of great intellect , noble in the high sense of the word , and gift with the power of work for the general welfare .
but the old he grow and the more intimately he come to know his brother , the oftener the thought occur to he that the power of work for the general welfare – a power of which he feel himself entirely destitute – be not a virtue but rather a lack of something : not a lack of kindly honesty and noble desire and taste , but a lack of the power of living , of what be call heart – the aspiration which make a man choose one out of all the innumerable path of life that present themselves , and desire that alone .
the well he know his brother , the more he notice that Koznyshev and many other social worker be not lead to this love for the common good by their heart , but because they have reason out in their mind that it be a good thing to do that kind of work , and take to it accordingly .
what far strengthen this conviction , be notice that his brother do not take the question of the general welfare , or of the immortality of the soul , any more to heart than a game of chess .
another thing which make Constantine Levin feel his brother 's presence inconvenient be that , in the country , especially during the summer , while Levin be always busy with the farm and the long summer day be too short for do all that have to be do , Koznyshev be rest .
but even though he be rest from mental labour and be not write , he be so used to mental activity that he like express his thought in an elegant , concise style , and like have a listener .
his most usual and natural listener be his brother ; and therefore , despite their friendly relation , Constantine feel uncomfortable at leave he alone .
Koznyshev love to lie bask in the sunshine , talk lazily .
' you can not imagine what a pleasure this complete laziness be to I : not a thought in my brain – you might send a ball roll through it ! '
but it weary Constantine to sit listen to he , particularly because he know that during his absence the manure be be cart into the field , and it be impossible to guess where they would throw it if he be not there to see . the ploughshare too would not be screw up properly , or take out ; and then he would be tell that these plough be a silly invention : ' how can they be compare to our old russian plough ? ' and so on .
' have not you walk about enough in this heat ? ' say Koznyshev .
' no ; I must just look in at the counting - house for a moment , ' answer Levin , and off he run to the field .
at the beginning of JUNE Levin 's old nurse and housekeeper , Agatha Mikhaylovna , happen to slip as she be carry to the cellar a jar of mushroom which she have just pickle , and sprain her wrist .
a talkative young medical man who have only just qualified and be appoint doctor for the Zemstvo district arrive , examine the hand , say it be not sprain , and enjoy a talk with the celebrated Sergius Ivanich Koznyshev . he tell he all the gossip of the district to show off his enlighten view and complain of the unsatisfactory condition prevail there .
Koznyshev listen attentively , ask question , and , enliven by the presence of a new listener , become quite chatty , make some pointed and weighty remark respectfully appreciate by the young doctor , and reach that state of animation his brother so well know , which generally follow a brilliant and lively conversation .
after the doctor 's departure Koznyshev feel inclined to go to the river with his fishing rod .
he be fond of angling , and seem proud of be able to like such a stupid occupation .
Constantine , who be oblige to go to the cornfield and meadow , offer to give his brother a lift in his trap .
it be just the time of year , the turning - point of summer , when the result of that year 's harvest becomes assure , when the autumn sowing have to be consider and when the hay harvest be close at hand ; when the grey - green rye wave its form but as yet not swollen ear lightly in the wind ; when the green oats , with irregular clump of yellow grass intersperse , stand unevenly on late - sow field ; when the early buckwheat spread out and hide the ground ; when the fallow land trodden as hard as a stone by the cattle , be half - plough , with here and there long strip omit as too hard for the plough ; when the smell of dry heap of manure in the field mingle with the honeyed perfume of the grass ; and wait for the scythe , the lowland meadow lie smooth as a lake by the river 's bank , show here and there black heap of weeded sorrel stalk .
it be the time of that short pause before the labour , yearly renew , of get in the harvest , which always demand all the peasant ' strength for its accomplishment .
the promise of the harvest be splendid , the weather clear and hot , and the short night dewy .
the brother have to pass through the forest on their way to the meadow .
Koznyshev be all the while fill with admiration for the beauty of the thickly - leave forest , and keep point out to his brother the old lime tree , look so dark on the shady side , cover with creamy bud all ready to burst into blossom ; or the new shoot , sparkle like emerald , on the tree .

word seem to detract from the beauty of what he be look at .

the thought of the hay harvest always touch he to the quick .

' have you find it , Fomich ? ' he ask .
' find it , indeed , Constantine Dmitrich !

' oh , well , our custom be to wait till St Peter 's .
Day , but you always mow early .
why not , God willing ?
the grass be fine ; there will be more room for the cattle . '

' that be God 's business – perhaps the weather will keep fine too . '

though he have catch nothing , Koznyshev do not feel bored and seem in the good of spirit .

why , you say just now ... '

the personal matter that OCCUPIED LEVIN while he be talk with his brother be this . the year before , when visit a field that be be mow , he have lose his temper with his steward , and to calm himself have use a remedy of his own – he take a scythe from one of the peasant and himself begin mow .

Levin recognize some of his own man .
Old Ermil , wear a very long white shirt [ russian peasant wear their shirt outside their trouser , like smock . ] be swinge his scythe , with his back bent ; young Vaska , who have be in Levin 's service as coachman , and who at each swing of his scythe cut the grass the whole width of his swath ; and Titus , Levin 's mow master , a thin little peasant , who go along without stop , mow his wide swath as if in play .
Levin dismount and , tether his horse by the roadside , go up to Titus , who fetch another scythe from behind a bush and give it to Levin .
' it be ready , master ! like a razor , it will mow of itself , ' say Titus , take off his cap and smile as he hand the scythe .

after breakfast LEVIN got PLACED between a humorous old man who invite he to be his neighbour and a young peasant who have only got marry last autumn and be now out for his first summer 's mowing .

OBLONSKY have gone to petersburg to fulfil a very necessary duty – which to official seem most natural and familiar , though to laymen it be incomprehensible – that of remind the Ministry of his existence , without the performance of which rite continuance in Government service be impossible . having take away with he all the money there be in the house , he contrive while attend to duty to pass his time very pleasantly , go to race and visit at country house .
meanwhile , to curtail expense , Dolly and her child move to the country . she go to Ergushevo , the estate which have form part of her dowry , about thirty - five mile distant from Levin 's Pokrovsk , and the very place where in spring the forest have be sell .
the old mansion on the estate have be pull down long ago , but there be a small house which have be enlarge and decorate by the Prince .
some twenty year before , when Dolly be still a child , that house have seem roomy and convenient , though in common with all house of the kind it stand away from the drive and have not a south aspect .
it be old and begin to decay .
in the spring , when Oblonsky go there to sell the forest , Dolly have ask he to look over the house and have all necessary repair do .
like all guilty husband Oblonsky be very anxious about his wife 's comfort , so he look over the house himself and give order to have everything do that seem to he necessary .
accord to he it be necessary to reupholster the furniture with new cretonne , to put up curtain , make the garden tidy , plant flower and build a bridge by the lake ; but he forget many other thing which be essential , and thus cause Dolly a great deal of trouble .
try as he would to be a considerate husband and father , Oblonsky never could remember that he have a wife and child .
he have the taste of a bachelor and understand no other .
when he return to Moscow he inform his wife that all be be prepare , that the house would look like a new toy , and advise she to move thither .
her departure for the country suit Oblonsky in every way : it be good for the child , expense would be cut down , and he would be free .
his wife , on the other hand , consider go to the country for the summer to be absolutely necessary for the child , especially for the little girl who have not recover her health after the scarlet fever ; and also in order to escape the humiliation of small debt for fuel , fish , boot , and so on , which torment she .
besides this she like the idea of go to her house in the country because she intend to get her sister Kitty , who be to return from abroad at midsummer and who have be order bathing , to join she there .
Kitty write from her watering - place that nothing seem so attractive as spend the summer with Dolly at Ergushevo , which be full of childhood 's memory for both of they .
the first day in the country be very try for Dolly .
in her girlhood she have live there and it have leave an impression on her mind as a place of refuge from all the unpleasantness of town ; life there , though very plain ( dolly be reconcile to that ) , be cheap and comfortable ; everything be cheap there and easy to get , and it would do the child good .
but when she come there as mistress of the house she see that thing be quite different from what she have expect .
the day after her arrival it pour with rain and in the night the rain come through into the passage and nursery , so that the child 's bed have to be carry into the drawing - room .
there be no scullery - maid . of the nine cow some , accord to the dairymaids , be about to calve , other have calve for the first time , some be too old , and the rest be difficult to milk , so there be no butter and scarcely enough milk even for the child .
there be no egg .
it be impossible to get a chicken , and they be oblige to boil and roast tough old purple - coloured rooster .
no peasant woman could be get to scrub the floor : they be all out planting potato .
it be impossible to go for a drive because one of the horse be restive and would not run in harness .
there be no place for bathing , the river bank be all trample over by the cattle and expose to the road ; it be not even possible to walk in the garden because the fence be break and the peasant ' cattle could get in , and the herd include a terrible bull that be give to bellow and would therefore probably toss .
there be nowhere to hang dress , because what few wardrobe there be would not shut , or else open of themselves when anyone pass by .
there be no mangle in the laundry , not even an ironing board , and no large pot or pan .
dolly , meet with these difficulty , so terrible from her point of view , instead of find peace and rest , be at first drive to despair . she bustle about and do her utmost ; but feel the hopelessness of her position , have to fight with the tear that rise every moment to her eye .
the steward , formerly a non - commissioned officer , to whom Oblonsky have take a fancy and whom he have promote from hall porter to steward because of the man 's handsome and respectful appearance , take no interest in his mistress 's trouble , only say in a deferential tone , ' quite impossible , the people be so abominable , ' and do nothing to help she .
the position seem irremediable ; but just as in other household , there be here in the Oblonskys ' house one inconspicuous yet most important and useful person : Matrena Filimonovna .
she console her mistress , assure she that everything would ' shape itself ( this phrase be her own , and Matthew have learn it from she ) , and she go to work deliberately and without excitement .
she at once make friend with the steward 's wife , and on the very day of the removal drink tea with she and with the steward beneath the laburnum , discuss arrangement .
a club be soon establish beneath the laburnum , consist of Matrena Filimonovna , the steward 's wife , the village elder , and the office clerk ; and by mean of this club the trouble begin gradually to subside , so that in a week 's time everything have really ' shape itself . '
the roof be mend , a scullery - maid – a relative of the elder 's – be engage , hen be buy , the cow give enough milk , the garden be fence in , a mangle be make by the carpenter , hook be put into the wardrobe , which no long open at their own sweet will ; an ironing board cover with coarse cloth lie across the arm of a chair and a chest of drawer in the maid 's room , and the smell of hot iron soon pervade the room .
' there , you see ! and you be quite in despair ! ' say Matrena Filimonovna , point to the board .
even a bathing - house be construct out of straw plait screen .
Lily start bathe , and at least part of Dolly 's expectation be fulfil , if not that of a quiet , at least that of a comfortable , country life .
dolly could not be quiet with six child , of whom one would fall ill , another be in danger of fall ill , a third be in want of something , a fourth show symptom of something bad in his disposition , etc . , etc .
very , very rare be the short interval of quiet .
but these care and anxiety be the only kind of happiness possible for Dolly .
have it not be for they she would have be leave to her thought about the husband who do not love she .
besides , painful as be for a mother the fear of illness , and sorrow at the appearance of evil tendency in her child , those child be already begin to repay her care by afford her small joy .
these joy be so trifle as to be as imperceptible as grain of gold among the sand , and in moment of depression she see nothing but the sand ; yet there be bright moment when she feel nothing but joy , see nothing but the gold .
