in the MIDDLE of JULY the elder from the village belong to Levin 's sister ( which lie fifteen mile from Pokrovsk ) come to see Levin and report on business matter and on the hay - harvest .
the chief income from his sister 's estate be derive from the meadow , which be flood every spring .
in former year the peasant use to buy the grass , pay seven rouble per acre for it .
when Levin take over the management of the estate he look into the matter , and , conclude that the grass be worth more , fix the price at eight rouble .
the peasant would not pay so much , and Levin suspect they of keep other buyer off .
then he go there himself and arrange to have the harvest gather in partly by hire labourer and partly by peasant pay in kind .
the local man oppose this innovation by all the mean in their power , but the plan succeed , and in the first year the meadow bring in almost double .
the next and third year the peasant still hold out and the harvest be get in by the same mean .
but this year the peasant have agree to get the harvest in and take one - third of all the hay in payment . now the elder have come to inform Levin that the hay be all make and that for fear of rain he have ask the steward to come , and in his presence have apportion the hay and have already stack eleven stack of the landlord 's share .
from the elder 's vague reply to Levin 's question as to how much hay the large meadow have yield , from his haste to apportion the hay without wait for permission , and from the general tone of the peasant , Levin know that there be something not quite square about the apportionment , and decide to go and investigate the matter himself .
Levin arrive at his sister 's village at noon and leave his horse with a friendly old peasant , the husband of his brother 's nurse . wish to hear particular of the hay harvest from this old man , Levin go to speak to he in his apiary .
Parmenich , a loquacious , handsome old man , welcome Levin joyfully , show he over his homestead , and tell he all about the swarm of his bee that year ; but to Levin 's question about the hay - harvest he give vague and reluctant answer .
this still far confirm Levin 's suspicion .
he go to inspect the hay , examine the stack , and see that there could not be fifty cartload in each . to put the peasant to the proof Levin order the cart on which the hay be be move to be fetch , and one of the stack to be carry to the barn .
there be only thirty - two load in the stack .
in spite of the elder 's explanation that the hay have be loose , but have settle down in the stack , and his swearing that all have be do in a ' godly way , ' Levin insist that the hay have be apportion without his order and that he would not accept the stack as contain fifty load each .
after lengthy dispute it be settle that the peasant themselves should take those eleven stack , count they at fifty load each and that the owner 's share should be measure afresh .
these dispute and the apportioning of the haycock go on till it be time for the evening meal .
when the last of the hay have be apportion , Levin entrust the rest of the supervision to the steward and seat himself on a haycock mark with a willow branch , look with enjoyment at the meadow teem with busy people .
before he , within the bend of the river , beyond a marsh , move a line of gaily - clothe woman , merrily chatter in their ring voice , while the scattered hay be quickly form into grey wave ridge on the light green meadow .
man with hayforks follow the woman , and the ridge grow into tall , wide and light haycock .
to the left , cart rattle along the bare meadow , and one after another the haycock vanish , pick up in enormous forkfuls , and their place be take by heavy cart with their huge load of scent hay overhang the horse ' back .
' make hay while the sun shine , and you will have plenty , ' remark the old beekeeper , sit down beside Levin . ' it be more like tea than hay !
see they pick it up , like duckling pick up the food you 've throw to they ! ' he add , point to where the hay be be load on the cart . ' they 've cart a good half since dinner time ...

' who be that ?
your son ? ' ask Levin .

' child !

they be load their cart not far away .

the young woman be work with ease , cheerfulness and skill .

Levin envy they their healthy gaiety and feel a wish to take part in that expression of the joy of live ; but he could do nothing except lie and look and listen .

for whom they have labour and what the fruit of their labour would be be an extraneous and unimportant affair .
Levin have often admire that kind of life , have often envy the folk who live it ; but that day , especially after what he have see for the first time of the relation between Vanka Parmenich and his young wife , it strike he that it depend on himself to change his wearisome , idle , and artificial personal life for that pure , delightful life of common toil .
the old man who have be sit beside he have long since go home .

' well , then , what shall I do ?
how shall I do it ? ' he ask himself , try to find expression for what he have be think and the feeling he have live through in that short night .
all his idea and feeling separate themselves into three different line of thought .
the first be how to renounce his old life and discard his quite useless education .
this renunciation would afford he pleasure and be quite easy and simple .
the second be concern with his notion of the life he now wish to lead .
he be distinctly conscious of the simplicity , purity , and rightness of that life , and be convince that in it he would find satisfaction , peace , and dignity , the absence of which be so painful to he .
but the third thought be the question of how to make the change from his present life to that other one .
and here no clear idea present itself to his mind .
should he have a wife ?
should he have work and the necessity to work ?
should he leave Pokrovsk , buy land , join a peasant commune , marry a peasant girl ? '
how be I to do it ? ' he again ask himself . , and could find no reply .
' however , I have not sleep all night and can not render a clear account of myself now , ' he think , ' but I will clear it up later .
one thing be certain : this night have decide my fate .
all my former dream of a family life be nonsense – not the right thing . everything be much simple and well than that ... '
' how beautiful ! ' he think , look up at a strange mother - of - pearl coloured shell form of fleecy cloud , in the centre of the sky just over his head . ' how lovely everything be , this lovely night !
and how do this shell get form so quickly ?
a little while ago when I look at the sky all be clear , but for two white strip .
my view of life have change in just the same unnoticeable way . '
leave the meadow , he go down the high road toward the village .
a slight breeze be blow and all look grey and dull .
there be generally a period of gloom just before daybreak and the complete triumph of light over darkness . shiver with cold Levin walk rapidly with his eye fix on the ground .
' what be that ? who can it be come ? ' think he , hear the tinkling of bell and raise his head .
at a distance of forty pace along the road on which he be walk he see a coach with four horse abreast and luggage on top approach he .
the horse be press close together away from the rut , but the skilful driver , sit sideways on the box , guide they so that the coach wheel run smoothly in the rut .
that be all Levin notice , and without wonder who might be inside he glance in at the window absent - mindedly .
in one corner an elderly woman be doze ; and close to the window sit a young girl who have just waken and be hold the ribbon of her white nightcap with both hand .
bright and thoughtful , full of that complicated refinement of a life to which Levin be a stranger , she look across he at the glow of dawn .
at the very moment when this vision be about to disappear , her candid eye fall on he .
she recognize he and joyful surprise light up her face .
he could not be mistaken .
there be no other eye in the world like they .
in the whole world there be only one be able to unite in itself the universe and the meaning of life for he .
it be Kitty .
he guess that she be on her way from the station to her sister 's house at Ergushevo .
all that have so disturbed Levin during the sleepless night and all his resolution vanish suddenly .
he recall with disgust his thought of marry a peasant girl .
there alone , inside that coach on the other side of the road , so rapidly recede from he , be the one possible solution of that riddle which have be weigh on he so painfully of late .
she do not look out again .
the sound of the wheel could no long be hear ; the tinkle of the bell grow fainter .
the barking of dog prove that the coach be pass through the village , and only the empty field , the village before he , and he himself walk solitary on the deserted road , be leave .
he look up at the sky , hope to find there the shell he have be admire , which have typify for he the reflection and feeling of the night .
there in the unfathomable height a mystic change be go on and he could see no sign of anything like a shell ; but a large cover of gradually diminish fleecy cloudlet be spread over half the sky , which have turn blue and grow bright .
it answer his questioning look with the same tenderness and the same remoteness .
' no , ' say he to himself . ' beautiful as be that life of simplicity and toil , I can not turn to it .
I love she ! '
none but those who know KARENIN most intimately know that this apparently cold and sober - minded man have one weakness , quite inconsistent with the general trend of his character .
Karenin could not with equanimity hear or see a child or a woman weep .
the sight of tear upset he and make he quite incapable of reasoning .
the chief of his staff and his secretary know this and warn woman who come with petition that they should on no account give way to tear if they do not want to spoil their case .
' he will get angry and will not listen to you , ' they say ; and in such case the mental perturbation which tear produce in Karenin really find expression in hurried burst of anger .
' I can do nothing for you .
kindly go away ! ' he would shout on these occasion .
when Anna on their way home from the race announce to he what her relation with Vronsky be and immediately hide her face in her hand and begin cry , Karenin , despite his indignation with she , be as usual overcome by that mental perturbation .
be aware of this and of the fact that any expression he could at that moment find for his feeling would be incompatible with the situation , he try to conceal all sign of life within himself and neither move nor look at she .
that be the cause of the strange deathlike look on his face which have so strike Anna .
when they reach home he help she out of the carriage and take leave of she with his usual courtesy , utter noncommittal word ; he say he would let she know his decision next day .
his wife 's word , confirm as they do his bad suspicion , have give Karenin a cruel pain in his heart .
this pain be render more acute by physical pity for she , evoke by her tear .
but when alone in the carriage , to his surprise and joy he feel completely relieve of that pity and of the suspicion and jealousy that have lately so torment he . he feel like a man who have just have a tooth draw which have be hurt he a long time .

what Karenin experience be a feeling of this kind : it have be a strange and terrible pain , but it be past , and he feel he could again live , and think of other thing beside his wife .
' without honour , without heart , without religion ; a depraved woman !
I know it and could see it all along , though I try out of pity for she to deceive myself , ' think he .
and it really seem to he that he have always see it . he recall all the detail of their past life , and detail which he have not previously consider wrong now prove to he clearly that she have always be deprave .
' I make a mistake when I bind up my life with hers , but in my mistake there be nothing blameworthy , therefore I ought not to be unhappy .
it be not I who be guilty , ' he say to himself , ' but it be she .
she do not concern I .
she do not exist for I . '
what would happen to she and to her son , toward whom his feeling have change as they have toward she , no long occupy his mind .

' I ought not to be unhappy because a despicable woman have commit a crime , but I must find the good way out of this painful situation in which she have place I . and find it I will , ' say he to himself , frown more and more .
' I be not the first and shall not be the last ' ; and without take into account the historical instance of wife ' unfaithfulness , begin with Menelaus and La Belle Hélène [ a comic opera , by Offenbach , just then in vogue in Moscow and Petersburg . ] whose memory have just recently be fresh in everybody 's mind , quite a number of case of infidelity , the infidelity of modern wife , occur to Karenin .
' Daryalov , Poltavsky , Prince Karibanov , Count Paskudin , Dram ...
yes , even Dram – that honest , business - like fellow ...
Semenov , Chagin , Sigonin : .. ' he pass they in review . ' it be true a kind of unreasonable ridicule fall on these man , but I never could see it in any other light than as a misfortune , and feel nothing but sympathy , ' Karenin reflect , though it be not true : he have never feel any sympathy of the kind , and the more case he have come across of husband be betray by their wife the well the opinion he have have of himself .
' it be a misfortune that may befall anyone and it have befall I .
the only question be , how good to face the situation . '
and he begin mentally review the course pursue by other man in similar position .
' Daryalov fight a duel ... '
in his youth Karenin have be particularly attract by the idea of duelling , just because he be physically a timid man and be quite aware of it .
he could not think without horror of a pistol be level at he and have never use any kind of weapon .
this horror have in his youth often induce he to take mental measure of his strength , in case he should ever be confront by a situation in which it would be necessary to face danger .
since , however , he have achieve success and gain a firm position in the world he have long forget that feeling ; but the old habit now revive and claim its own , and the fear of be a coward be again so strong that he consider this point a long time and flatter his vanity with the idea of a duel , though he know beforehand that he would on no account fight one .
' of course our Society be still so uncivilized – not as in England – that very many ' ( among the many be those whose opinion Karenin particularly value ) ' would regard a duel as the right thing ; but what object would be gain ?
supposing I challenge he ... ' continue Karenin ; and vividly picture to himself the night he would spend after the challenge , and the sensation of have a pistol point at he , he shudder and realize that he would never do it . ' suppose , ' he go on , ' they show I how to do it , place I , and I pull the trigger ... '
he close his eye ... ' and it turn out that I have kill he ... ' and he shake his head to drive away the stupid thought . ' what sense be there in kill a man in order to define one 's relation with a guilty wife and a son ?
nevertheless , I shall have to decide what to do with she .
' but what be even more likely – and sure to happen – be that I should be kill or wound .
then I , an innocent man , should be the victim .
that would be still more senseless .
and this be not all . a challenge from I would not be an honest action .
do I not know beforehand that my friend would never allow I to go so far as to fight a duel , would not allow a statesman whom Russia need to expose himself to danger ?
what , then , would happen ?
this would happen : I , know beforehand that matter would never be allow to reach a dangerous point , should have challenge a man in order to cover myself with false glamour .
that would be dishonest , it would be false , it would be deceive myself as well as other .
no ! a duel be unthinkable and no one expect it of I .
my aim be to safeguard my reputation , which I need for the uninterrupted pursuit of my career . '
his official pursuit , which have always appear essential to Karenin , now assume even great importance .
having consider and reject the idea of a duel , Karenin turn his thought to divorce , the next expedient of which some of the wrong husband he remember have avail themselves .
go over all the case of divorce he know – there be very many , and in the high Society , with which he be well acquaint – Karenin could not recall one in which the purpose of the divorce be the one he have in view .
in all these case the husband have cede or sell the unfaithful wife , and the very person who accord to law have no right to re - marry enter into fictitious , pseudo - legal relation with a pretended husband .
Karenin see that in his own case it would be impossible to obtain a legal divorce – that is , a divorce in which the guilty wife would be simply cast off .
he know that in their complex condition of life it would not be possible to obtain those coarse proof of a wife 's infidelity which the law demand ; he know that in that life there be a certain convention of refinement which would not allow he to bring forward such proof , have they exist , because such an action would make he sink even lower than she in public opinion .
to attempt a divorce could only lead to a lawsuit and a scandal which would give his enemy great opportunity for calumny , and would lower his high position in Society .
the chief object of his life , the settling of condition with the least possible amount of disturbance , could not be further by divorce .
besides , it be evident that as a consequence of divorce the wife would break off relation with her husband and unite with her lover .
in Karenin 's soul , however , despite the complete and contemptuous indifference he think he feel for his wife , there be one feeling leave with regard to she : an objection to she be in a position to unite unhindered with Vronsky , so make her crime advantageous to she .
the very thought of it irritate he to such an extent that he groan with inner pain , rise , and change his place in the carriage and for a long while after that he sit wrap his fluffy rug round his bony , easily - chilled leg .

' in confirmation of this decision , after it have already be reach , another powerful argument occur to Karenin .
' it be only by this course that I can conform with religion , ' say he to himself . ' it be the only way that make it possible for I not to disown my guilty wife and to give she a chance of repent , and even , painful as it will be , to devote part of my power to her redemption . '
though Karenin know that he could have no moral influence on his wife , that all his attempt to redeem she would lead to nothing but lie , and although during the painful moment he have live through he have not once think of seek guidance in religion , now that his decision be , as he imagine , in conformity with religion , its sanction afford he great satisfaction and even some comfort .
it be pleasant to think that no one would have a right to say that in such an important crisis in his life he have not act in accordance with that religion whose banner he have always hold aloft amid general coldness and indifference .
proceeding to consider further detail , Karenin could not even see why his relation with his wife should not remain almost the same as before .
he could of course never again revive his respect for she ; but there be no occasion for he to spoil his own life and to suffer just because she have prove a bad and unfaithful wife .
' yes , time go on ; and time , which cure everything , will restore the old condition , ' say Karenin to himself . ' that is , it will restore they in so far that I shall not have this worry during the rest of my life .

by the TIME he reach petersburg Karenin have not only resolve to keep to his decision , but have mentally compose a letter to his wife .

' during our last conversation I express my intention of communicate my decision with reference to the subject of that conversation .

a. KARENIN
' P.S. – I enclose some money , which you may need for your expense . '

Karenin know that this be really so .

( many people live by it , especially one very moral and musical family in which the daughter all play stringed instrument .

he would demand the appointment of a special Committee to inquire into the case of the subject race in that Province .
the case of the subject race have be accidentally raise at the Committee of 2nd June and have be energetically insist on by Karenin , as a matter of urgency in view of their wretched condition .

THOUGH ANNA have ANGRILY and obstinately contradict Vronsky when he say that her position be an impossible one , in the depth of her soul she feel that the situation be a false one and wish with all her heart to put an end to it .
on her way back from the race , in a moment of excitement in spite of the pain it cause she – she have tell her husband everything , and she be glad she have do so .
after he leave she , she tell herself that she be glad she have tell he , that now everything would be definite – at any rate , the falsehood and deception would no long exist .
she think it quite certain that her position would be clear up for good .
her new position might be a bad one but it would be definite , and there would be no vagueness or falsehood .
the pain she have inflict on herself and her husband would now , she think , be compensate for by the fact that the matter would be settle .
she see Vronsky that same evening , but do not tell he what have pass between she and her husband , though he would have to be tell before her position could be settle .

but the word have be speak and Karenin have go away without say anything .
' I see Vronsky and do not tell he .
just as he be go away I wish to call he back and tell he , but change my mind , because my not having do so at first would have appear strange .
why do I not tell he ? '
and in answer to this question a hot blush of shame spread all over her face .

she dread the disgrace , which she have not consider before .

she ask herself where she would go when turn out , and find no answer .

' do come , if only to study manner and custom .
I expect you , ' she write in conclusion .
Anna read the note and sigh deeply . ' I do not want anything , anything at all , ' she say to Annushka , who be move the bottle and brush on the dressing table .

' mama ! I ...
I ... I ... ' he say , try to find out from her face what he be to expect for eat the peach .

after the thunderstorm of the last few day the weather have grow clear and cold .

in spite of his apparently reckless EXISTENCE , VRONSKY be a man who hate disorder .
while quite young and still in the Cadet Corps he have experience the humiliation of a refusal when , having get into debt , he have try to borrow money , and since then he have never again allow himself to get into such a position .
to keep thing straight he be in the habit , some five or six time a year accord to circumstance , of seclude himself and clear up all his affair .
he call it have a clean up , or faire la lessive . [ do the washing . ]
the morning after the race he wake late , and without have a bath or shaving he put on a linen tunic and , spread out before he his money , his account , and his bill and letter , he set to work .
when Petritsky – who know that on such occasion Vronsky be often cross – on waking see his friend at his writing - table , he dress quietly and go out without disturb he .
every one , know intimately all the complexity of his own circumstance , involuntarily assume that these complexity and the difficulty of clear they up be peculiar to his own personal condition , and never think that other be surround by similar complexity .
and so thought Vronsky .
and not without some inward pride , nor without some justification , he reflect that any other man would long ago have got embroil and be oblige to act badly if place in a situation as difficult as his .
but Vronsky feel that it be necessary for he to investigate his affair just at that time in order to keep out of trouble .
he begin by first attack his money problem , as the easy to deal with .
having note down in his small handwriting on a piece of notepaper all he owe , he make up the account and find that it come to seventeen thousand and a few hundred rouble .
having strike out the odd hundred in order to have a round sum , count his money and look over his bank - book , he find that he have 1800 rouble , and there be no prospect of receive any more before the New Year .
after read over the list of his debt , he divide they into three class , each of which he note down separately .
under the first head come the debt that have to be pay at once or the money for which have at any rate to be keep ready so that they could be pay on demand without any delay .
these debt come to about 4000 rouble : 1500 for a horse and 2500 he have incur by stand security for his young comrade Venevsky , who in Vronsky 's presence have lose that sum to a card - sharp .
Vronsky have wish to pay at the time – he have the money with he – but Venevsky and Yashvin insist that they would pay , and would not permit Vronsky , who have not even be play , to do so .
this be all very fine , but Vronsky know that in this dirty business , his share in which be simply a verbal guarantee for Venevsky , he must have the 2500 rouble ready to throw to the sharp , and then have no more to do with he .
so that for the first part of his debt he must have 4000 rouble ready .
eight thousand rouble under the second heading be less important : they be owe chiefly for the use of the racecourse stable , to the oats and hay - dealer , to the Englishman , to the saddler and other .
in respect of these debt it be necessary to pay out 2000 rouble , in order to be quite secure .
the remain debt be owe to shop , hotel , and to his tailor , and there be no need to trouble about they .
so he need 6000 rouble for immediate use , and have only 1800 rouble ready money .
to a man with an income of 100,000 rouble a year , as everybody say Vronsky have , it would seem that such debt could not cause any difficulty , but the fact be that he be far from have the 100,000 rouble .
his father 's immense fortune , which alone bring in 200,000 a year , have not be divide between the brother .
when the eld brother , have a number of debt , marry the Princess Varya Chirkova , the daughter of a penniless Decembrist , Alexis give up to his brother the income from his father 's fortune , stipulate for only 25,000 rouble a year for himself .
at that time Alexis tell his brother that this would suffice for he till he marry , which in all probability he never would do .
and his brother , command one of the most expensive regiment , and newly married , could not refuse this gift .
their mother , who have her own private fortune , allow Alexis about 20,000 rouble a year in addition to the 25,000 agree upon , and Alexis spend it all .
latterly his mother , having quarrel with he about his connection with Anna and his departure from Moscow , have stop his allowance .

VRONSKY be particularly fortunate in that he have a code of rule which clearly define what should and should not be do .
this code cover a very small circle of condition , but it be unquestionable , and Vronsky , never go beyond that circle , never for a moment hesitate to do what have to be do .
the code categorically determine that though the card - sharp must be pay , the tailor need not be ; that one may not lie to a man , but might to a woman ; that one must not deceive anyone , except a husband ; that one must not forgive an insult but may insult other , and so on .
these rule might be irrational and bad but they be absolute , and in comply with they Vronsky feel at ease and could carry his head high .
only quite lately , in reference to his relation to Anna , have he begin to feel that his code do not quite meet all circumstance , and that the future present doubt and difficulty for which he have no guide principle .
his present relation to she and her husband be clear and simple to he .
they be very clearly and exactly define in the code of rule by which he be guide .
she be a respectable woman who have give he her love , and he love she ; therefore she be for he a woman worthy of as much or even more respect than a legitimate wife .
he would have let his hand be cut off before he would have allow himself by word or hint to insult she , or fail to show she all the respect that a woman can possibly desire .
his relation toward Society be also clear .
every one might know or suspect , but no one must dare to speak about the matter , or he be prepared to silence the speaker and make he respect the non - existent honour of the woman he love .
his relation to her husband be simple of all .
from the moment that Anna give he her love he consider his own right to her indefeasible .
her husband be only a superfluous person and a hindrance .
no doubt he be in a pitiable position , but what be to be do ?
the only right the husband have be , weapon in hand , to demand satisfaction , and that Vronsky from the first be prepare to give he .

he have make this proposal , but now , think it over , he see clearly that it would be well to avoid that plan , and yet , while he tell himself so , he fear that this might be wrong .
' when I tell she to leave her husband , that mean that she should unite herself with I .

no doubt I could arrange that ... but how could I go away with she while I be in the army ?

ON MONDAY the usual meeting of the committee of the Second of July take place .
Karenin enter the Council room , greet the member and the president as usual , and take his seat , his hand lie ready on the paper before he .
among these paper be the statistic that he need and a draft of the statement he be go to make .

the night LEVIN have spend ON the HAYCOCK have not pass without leave its mark : he become disgusted with the agricultural pursuit on which he be engage and lose all interest in they .
in spite of the splendid harvest he have never , or think he have never , encounter so many failure , or so much hostility from the peasant , as that year ; and the cause of those failure and that hostility be now quite plain to he .
the delight he have feel in the labour itself , occasion by his having draw near to the peasant , his jealousy of they , his envy of their life , his desire to adopt that kind of life ( which have not be a mere desire that night but a real intention , the detail of which he have consider ) , all these thing together have so change his outlook on the working of his estate that he could no long feel his former interest in the work , or help notice the unpleasant relation to the labourer on which it be all base .
herd of cattle of an improved breed like Pava , the till land plough with good plough , the nine field surround with willow , the hundred of acre of deeply manure land , the seed drill and all such thing , be splendid if they could be work by himself alone or with the help of friend and people in sympathy with he .
but now he clearly see ( the book on agriculture which he be write , in which the labourer be the chief factor in farming , help much in this direction ) that the agricultural work he be carry on be found on a bitter and obstinate struggle between himself and his labourer , in which on the one side – his – there be a continual and strenuous attempt to bring everything into accord with what be consider the good model , while on the other side there be the natural order of thing .
and he see that in his struggle , in spite of extreme effort on his part , and without any effort or even intention on the part of other , the only result achieve be that neither side be the winner , and that fine tool and splendid cattle and soil be quite uselessly damage .
but the chief point be that not only be the energy expend on the work waste , but he could not help feel now , when he see the meaning of his pursuit lay bare before he , that the aim of his effort be a most unworthy one .
what be the essential cause of that hostility ?
he struggle to get every penny he could , and have to do so or he would not have be able to pay his labourer their wage , and they struggle to be allow to work quietly , pleasantly , and just as they be use to work .
it be to his interest that every labourer should get through as much work as possible and at the same time give his mind to it , not injure the winnowing machine , the horse - rake , or the threshing machine , but work intelligently .
the labourer wish to work in the pleasantest way possible , with interval of rest , and especially to think unconcernedly about other thing without have to reason .
during that summer Levin notice this continually .
he give order to mow the clover for hay , choose the inferior field overgrown with grass and hemlock and not fit for seed ; and they cut down all the good seed clover , defend themselves by say that the foreman order they to do it , and comfort he with the assurance that he would get splendid hay ; while he know that they have do it simply because that clover be easiest to mow . he send out the horse - rake to turn the hay and it got break while toss the first few row , because the peasant find it dull to sit in the seat under the rotate wing , and Levin be tell : ' do not worry , sir !
the woman will toss it all in no time ! ' the english plough turn out useless , because it never enter the peasant 's head to lower the upturned ploughshare , and as he force it through at the turning he spoil the ground and strain the horse , and Levin be tell not to worry !
the horse be allow to stray into the wheat - field because not one of the peasant want to be watchman , and in spite of its having be forbid the labourer take turn to watch the horse at night ; so Vanka ; who have be at work all day , fall asleep , and confess his guilt , say , ' I be in your hand , sir ! ' three of the good calf have be overfe by be turn into the meadow where the clover have be cut , without any water to drink ; and the peasant would on no account admit that the clover have injure they .
to comfort Levin he be tell that his neighbour have lose a hundred head of cattle in three day . all this happen not because anyone wish to harm Levin or his farming ; on the contrary he well know that they like he and consider he a homely gentleman – high praise from a peasant .
it be do simply because the labourer wish to work merrily and without care , while his interest be not only foreign and incomprehensible to they but flatly opposed to their own just interest . Levin have long feel dissatisfied with his relation to the work on his estate .
he have see that the boat be leak but have not find or look for the leak , and perhaps have purposely deceive himself , for have he be disillusion in that work , he would have have nothing leave . but now he could deceive himself no long .

Sviyazhsky be an extreme liberal .

he consider Russia to be a doomed country like Turkey , and the russian government so bad that he do not think it worth while seriously to criticize its action ; yet he have an official position , be a model Marshal of the Nobility , and when he travel always wear a cockade and a red band to his cap .

' I ought to have say to he : " you say that our farming be not a success because the peasant hate all improvement and that these should be introduce by force ; and if farming do not pay at all without these improvement , you would be right . but it succeed where and only where ( as in the case of the man at the halfway - house ) the labourer act in conformity with their habit .

the carrying out of LEVIN 's plan present many difficulty , but he struggle with all his might to attain , if not all he desire , at any rate a possibility of believe without self - deception that the thing be worth do .

the naive peasant , the cowman Ivan , quite understand Levin 's offer of let he and his family have a share in the profit of the dairy farm , and quite sympathize with this undertaking : but when Levin impress upon he the benefit that would accrue to he in the future , a look of anxiety and regret that he could not stop to listen to it all appear on Ivan 's face , and he hurriedly remember some task that could not be put off , seize a hay - fork to remove the hay from the enclosure , fetched water , or clear away the manure .

they be firmly convinced that his real aim ( whatever he might say ) would always be hide in what he do not tell they .

yet in spite of all these difficulty he get his way , and by autumn the scheme begin to work , or at any rate it seem so to he .
at first Levin think of let the whole of his farm as it stand to the peasant , to the labourer , and to his steward , on the new co - partnership line , but he very soon see that this be impossible and decide to divide up the different part .
the cattle - yard , the fruit and vegetable garden , the meadow and the corn - field , divide into several part , should come under different section .
the naive Ivan , who , it seem to Levin , well understand the plan , form an artel [ an artel be a workman 's profit - sharing association , with mutual responsibility , common in Russia . ] consist chiefly of his own family , and become partner in the dairy section .

'

it be true that Shuraev have take step to sublet the kitchen garden in small lot to the other peasant ; he evidently quite misunderstood , and apparently intentionally misunderstood , the condition on which the land be let to he .

political economy maintain that the law by which the wealth of Europe have develop and be develop be universal and unquestionable law .
the socialistic teaching declare that development on those line lead to ruin .
but neither the one set of book nor the other so much as hint at explain what Levin , and all the russian peasant and landowner with their million of hand and acre , should do to make they as productive as possible for the general welfare .

often , just as he be begin to understand the idea in his interlocutor 's mind and to explain his own , he would suddenly be ask : and what about Kauffmann and Jones , and Dubois and Michelli ? '

he now clearly see that Kauffmann and Michelli have nothing to tell he .

he see that Russia have splendid soil and splendid labourer and that in some case ( such as that of the peasant at the halfway house ) the labourer and land produce much : but that in the majority of case , when capital be expend in the european way , they produce little , and that this happen simply because the labourer be only willing to work and work well , in the way natural to they , and that their opposition be not accidental but permanent , be root in the spirit of the people .

this he want to prove theoretically in his book and practically by his farming .

the weather grow still bad toward evening and the frozen sleet beat the whole body of his drenched horse so painfully that it shake its head and ear and go sideways . but Levin under his hood feel comfortable ; he look cheerfully round , now at the turbid stream that run down the rut , now at the drop that hang from every bare twig , now at the white spot of unthawed sleet that lie on the plank of the bridge or on the heap of still juicy willow leave lie in a thick layer round a denuded tree .

' I need only push on steadily toward my aim and I shall achieve it , ' he think , ' and it be worth work and strive for .

the whole system of farming , and above all the position of the people , must be completely alter : instead of poverty – wealth and satisfaction for all ; instead of hostility – concord and a bond of common interest .
in a word – a revolution bloodless but immense ; first in our own small district , then throughout the province , throughout Russia , and the whole world – for a good thought must be fruitful .
yes it be an aim worth work for !
the fact that the author of it be myself , Constantine Levin , who once go to a ball in a black tie , whom Kitty Shcherbatskaya refuse , and who seem so pitiful and insignificant to himself prove nothing .

LEVIN have long AGO NOTICED that after people have make one uncomfortable by their pliancy and submissiveness they soon become unbearably exact and aggressive .

PART IV
the karenin , HUSBAND and WIFE , continue to live in the same house and to meet daily , but they be wholly estranged .
Karenin make it a rule to see his wife every day , so as not to give the servant any ground for make conjecture , but he avoid dining at home .
Vronsky never come to the Karenins ' house , but Anna meet he elsewhere and her husband know it .
the situation be a torment to all three , and not one of they could have stand it for a single day but for the hope that it would change and that the whole matter be only a temporary , though painful , trial .
Karenin expect the passion to pass , as everything pass ; all would be forget and his name not dishonoured .
Anna , who be responsible for the situation , and for whom among the three it be most painful , bear it because she not only expect , but feel sure , that very soon everything would be settle and clear up .
she have not the least idea what would settle it , but be quite certain that it would now come very soon .
involuntarily submit to her judgment , Vronsky too expect something , not dependent on he , to clear up all these difficulty .
in the middle of the winter he spend a very dull week .
he have be choose to act as guide to a foreign Prince , and be oblige to show he the sight of Petersburg .
Vronsky have a distinguished appearance , possess the art of carry himself with respectful dignity , and be in the habit of associate with people of that class .
that be why he be choose to attend the Prince ; but the task seem a hard one to he .
the Prince do not want to miss see anything about which he might be question at home and he also want to enjoy as many russian amusement as possible ; and Vronsky be oblige to accompany he in both case .
in the morning they go sight - seeing , and in the evening take part in the national amusement .
the Prince enjoy unusually good health even for a Prince , and by mean of gymnastic and care of his body have develop his strength to such a degree that , in spite of the excess he indulge in when amusing himself , he look as fresh as a big green shine cucumber .
he have travel a great deal , and consider that one of the chief advantage of the present convenient way of communication be the easy access they afford to national amusement .
he have be to Spain , where he arrange serenade and become intimate with a spanish woman who play the mandoline .
in Switzerland he have shoot a chamois , in England he have jump hedge in a pink coat and shoot two hundred pheasant for a bet .
he have be in a harem in Turkey , ride an elephant in India , and now in Russia he want a taste of distinctive russian amusement .
Vronsky , who be , so to say , the Prince 's chief master of ceremony , have great difficulty in organize all the russian amusement offer to the Prince by various people : trotting - race , pancake , bear - hunting , and drive in three - horse sledge , gipsy , and russian spree with smashing of crockery .
and the Prince imbibe the russian spirit with the great ease , smash tray full of crockery , make gipsy girl sit on his lap , and yet seem to be always ask : ' what next ? be this the whole of the russian spirit ? '
but , on the whole , of all the russian amusement the Prince like the french actress , a ballet girl , and white - seal champagne good .
Vronsky be use to Princes , but whether it be that he himself have lately change , or whether his intimacy with this Prince be too close , that week at any rate appear very wearisome to he . all that week he feel like a man attend a lunatic and afraid for his own reason too .
he be oblige to be on his guard the whole time not to deviate from the path of severe official respect , for fear of be insult .
the Prince 's manner toward the very people who , to Vronsky 's astonishment , be ready to go through fire and water to provide russian amusement for he , be contemptuous .
his opinion of russian woman , whom he want to study , more than once make Vronsky flush with indignation .
but the chief reason why the Prince 's presence oppress Vronsky be that he see himself reflect in the Prince , and what he see in that mirror be not flattering to his vanity .
the Prince be a very stupid , very healthy and very cleanly man – and nothing more .
he be a gentleman , it be true , and Vronsky could not deny it .
he be quiet and not cringe with those above he , free and simple with his equal , and contemptuously good - natured with his inferior .
Vronsky be the same , and consider it very meritorious to be so , but in his relation with the Prince he be the inferior and feel indignant with that condescendingly good - natured treatment .
' Stupid ox ! can I really be like that myself ? ' he think .
however this may have be , he part from the Prince ( who go on to Moscow ) and receive his thank . Vronsky be very pleased to be rid of the embarrassing situation and the unpleasant mirror .
he take leave of he at the railway station on the seventh day , on return from a bear - hunt , after which there have be demonstration of russian ' prowess ' all night .
ON returning home Vronsky find a note from Anna await he .
she write , ' I be ill and unhappy .
I can not go out , neither can I go on any long without see you .
come this evening ; Alexis Alexandrovich be go to the Council and will remain there till ten . '

' what have happen ?

KARENIN after meeting VRONSKY in his own porch go on as have be his intention to the Italian Opera .
he sit through the first two act and see everybody that it be necessary for he to see .
on his return home he carefully look at the coat - stand , and notice that no military coat hang there he go to his study as usual ; contrary to his habit , however , he do not go to bed but walk up and down the room till three in the morning .

she have not fulfil his condition and he be oblige to punish she and carry out his threat : to divorce she and take away her son .
he know the difficulty connect with such a step : but he have say he would do it and be now oblige to do it .
the Countess Lydia Ivanovna have hint to he that that be the good way to get out of the situation , and he know that of late the practice of divorce have be bring to such a state of perfection that he see a possibility of overcome the formal difficulty .

KARENIN have gain a brilliant victory at the Committee Meeting of the seventeenth of August ; but the consequence of that victory undermine his power .
the new committee for investigate the condition of the subject - race from every point of view have be form and send to its field of action with unusual promptitude and energy , stir up by Karenin .
three month later the committee send in its report .
the subject - race ' condition have be investigate from the political , administrative , economic , ethnographical , material , and religious point of view .
all the question have receive splendidly - draft answer : answer not open to doubt since they be not the result of human thought ( always liable to error ) , but be the outcome of official labour .
all the answer be base on official datum : report from Governors and Bishops , base on report from district authority and ecclesiastical superintendent , base in their turn on report from rural administrative officer and parish priest ; therefore these answer could not admit of any doubt .
all the question as to why they have bad harvest , for instance , or why the native keep to their own creed and so on , question which without the convenience of the official machine do not get solve and can not get solve for century , have receive clear and certain solution .
and the solution arrive at be in accord with Karenin 's opinion .
but Stremov , who have be touch to the quick at the last meeting , make use of tactic for which Karenin be not prepared .
Stremov suddenly change over to Karenin 's side , bring several other member in his train , and not only warmly support the measure advocate by Karenin , but propose other more extreme measure of the same nature .
these measure , go beyond Karenin 's original idea , be accept , and then Stremov 's tactic become manifest .
the measure , carry to extreme , prove so stupid that person in office , public opinion , intellectual woman , and the Press , all at the same moment fall upon they , express indignation at the measure themselves , and at Karenin , their acknowledge originator .
Stremov stand aside , pretend to have blindly follow Karenin 's plan and to be himself indignant now at what have be do , thus undermine Karenin .
but , in spite of fail health and family trouble , Karenin do not give in .
there be a split in the Committee .
some of the member , with Stremov at their head , excuse their mistake by maintain that they have put their faith in the report present by the Revisory Committee direct by Karenin ; and say that that Committee 's report be nonsense and nothing but waste paper .
Karenin and a number of other see danger in so revolutionary an attitude toward official document and continue to support the datum present by the Committee .
in consequence , the high circle and even Society become quite confused and , though everybody be deeply interested in the question , no one could make out whether the subject - race be really suffer and perish or be flourish .
Karenin 's position , partly in consequence of this and partly from the contempt that fall on he as a result of his wife 's infidelity , become very shaky .
in these circumstance he take an important resolution .
he announce , to the surprise of the Committee , that he would ask to be allow to go and investigate the matter himself , and having receive permission he start for the distant Provinces .
Karenin 's departure be much talk about , especially because just before start he formally return the post - fare sufficient to pay for twelve horse all the way to his destination , which have be advanced to he .
' I consider it very fine of he , ' the Princess Betsy say , refer to it in a conversation with Princess Myagkaya . ' why should they pay for post - horse when everybody know that we now have railway everywhere ? '
but the Princess Myagkaya do not agree , and be even irritated by Princess Tverskaya 's view .
' it be all very well for you to talk who possess I do not know how many million , ' she say . ' but I be very glad when my husband go on inspection - tour in summer .
it be very good for his health , and pleasant for he ; and we have an arrangement by which this allowance go for the hire of a carriage and coachman for I . '

PESTSOV liked to bring his discussion to a finish , and have not be satisfied with Koznyshev 's remark , especially as he feel the fallacy of his own opinion .
' I do not mean , ' he begin over his soup , address Karenin , ' the density of population alone , but that combine with firm foundation . it be not principle that count . '
' it seem to I , ' reply Karenin deliberately and languidly , ' that it be one and the same thing .
in my opinion only that nation which be more highly develop can influence another , only that ... '
' but the question be , ' interrupt Pestsov in his deep voice – he be always in a hurry to speak and always seem to stake his whole soul on what he be talk about – ' what do " high development " consist of ?
the English , the French , or the Germans , which of they be more highly develop ?
which will nationalize the other ?
we see that the Rhine have become Frenchified , yet the Germans do not stand on a low level ! ' he shout . ' there be some other law ! '
' I think that the influence will always be on the side of the truly educate , ' say Karenin slightly raise his eyebrow .
' but what should we consider to be the sign of " true education " ? ' say Pestsov .
' I fancy that those sign be well know , ' reply Karenin .
' be they fully know ? ' intervene Koznyshev with a subtle smile . ' at present a purely classical education be regard as the only real education , but we hear lively discussion from both side and can not deny that the opposite view have many argument in its favour . '
' you be a classic , Sergius Ivanich !

' I have have a classical education , but can personally find no place in that controversy . I see no clear proof that a classical education should be prefer to a modern education . '
' natural science have just as great an educational and mind - develop influence , ' Pestsov join in . ' take astronomy , take botany , or zoology with its system of general law ! '
' I can not quite agree with you , ' answer Karenin . ' it seem to I that we must admit that the process of study the form of a language have in itself a beneficial effect on spiritual development .
besides it be impossible to deny that the influence of the classic be in the high degree a moral one , whereas unfortunately with instruction in natural science be connect those dangerous and false teaching which be the bane of the present time . '

chapter XXI

chapter XXVIII
when VRONSKY and ANNA REACHED petersburg they put up at one of the good hotel : Vronsky separately on the first floor , and Anna with the baby , the nurse , and a maid , upstairs in a large suite consist of four room .
on the day they arrive Vronsky go to see his brother .
there he meet his mother , who have come from Moscow on business .

his brother , however , having come to see he next morning , ask about she , and Alexis Vronsky tell he frankly that he regard his union with she as a marriage , that he hope to arrange a divorce for she , and would then marry she , and that meanwhile he consider she his wife , just like any other wife , and he ask his brother to say so to their mother and to his own wife .
' if the world do not approve of it , I do not care , ' say Vronsky , ' but if my relative wish to treat I as a relation , they must adopt a similar attitude toward my wife . '

VRONSKY and ANNA WENT ON living in the country in the same way , still take no step to obtain a divorce , all the summer and part of the autumn .
they have agree not to go away anywhere , but the long they live alone the more they both feel – especially in autumn when there be no visitor – that they would not be able to hold out and that a change be inevitable .
their life seem one that could not be improve upon : they have ample mean , good health , a child , and both have occupation of their own .
in the absence of visitor Anna still continue to devote attention to her person , and read a great deal – both novel and such serious book as be in fashion .
she order all the book that be praise in the foreign newspaper and magazine they receive , and read they with the attention one give only to what one read in solitude .

Vronsky appreciate this , which have become the sole aim of her life , a desire not only to please he but also to serve he ; but at the same time he be trouble by these love - mesh in which she try to entangle he .
as time go on , the oftener he feel himself catch in these mesh the more he desire , not exactly to escape from they but to try whether they really interfere with his freedom .
have it not be for this ever - increase desire for freedom – not to have a scene each time he have to go to town to a meeting or to the race – Vronsky would have be quite content with his life .
the role he have choose , that of a rich landowner – one of those who should constitute the kernel of the russian aristocracy – be not only quite to his taste but , now that he have live so for half a year , give he ever - increase pleasure .
his affair , which occupy and absorb he more and more , progress excellently .
in spite of the tremendous sum the hospital , the machinery , the cow which he import from Switzerland , and many other thing be cost he , he be sure that he be not waste his substance but increase it .
where it be a question of income – the sale of forest land , of corn or wool , or the leasing of land – Vronsky be as hard as flint and could hold out for his price .
in all operation on a large scale , both on this and on his other estate , he keep to the simple and safe method , and be extremely economical and careful in his expenditure on small detail .
despite all the cunning and artfulness of the german steward , who try to lead he into expenditure and present all estimate in such a way that it at first appear as if much would be require , though on consideration the thing could be do more cheaply and an immediate profit obtain , Vronsky do not submit to he .
he listen to what the steward have to say and question he , but only consent when the thing to be order or build be the late , as yet unknown in Russia , and likely to astonish people .
besides , he decide on a big outlay only when he have money to spare , and when spend he go into every detail and insist on get the very good for his money .
so that from the way he manage his business it be clear that he be not waste but increase his property .
in October there be the Nobility election in the Kashin Province , in which Vronsky 's , Sviyazhsky 's , Koznyshev 's , and also a small part of Levin 's estate be situate .

ON the SIXTH day the provincial election be to be hold .

at the MATINÉE concert there be two very interesting item .
one be King Lear on the Heath , a fantasia , and the other be a quartet dedicate to the memory of Bach .
both piece be new and in the new style , and Levin be lead to form an opinion on they .
when he have conduct his sister - in - law to her seat , he take his station behind a pillar , resolve to listen as attentively and as conscientiously as possible .
he try not to let his mind wander nor to let his impression of the music be mar by look at the white - tie conductor 's arm - waving , which always so unpleasantly distract one 's attention from the music ; nor by the lady with their bonnet , the ribbon of which be so carefully tie over their ear for the concert , nor by all those other person who be either not interested in anything or be interested in all sort of thing other than music .
he carefully avoid the musical expert and great talker , and stand with lower eye gaze straight before he , listen .
but the long he listen to the King Lear fantasia , the far he feel from the possibility of form any definite opinion .
the musical expression of some emotion seem perpetually on the point of beginning , when it suddenly break into fragment of the expression of other emotion or even into unrelated sound which , elaborate though they be , be only connect by the whim of the composer .
even these fragment of musical expression , though some of they be good , be unpleasing because they be quite unexpected and unprepared for .
mirth , sadness , despair , tenderness , triumph come forth without any cause , like the thought of a madman .
and , as in the mind of a madman , these emotion vanish just as unexpectedly .
throughout the performance Levin feel like a deaf person watch a dance .
he be quite perplexed when the music stop and feel very tired as a result of strained attention quite unrewarded .
from all side come loud applause .
every one rise , begin to walk about , and to talk .
wish to clear up his own perplexity by hear other people 's impression , Levin go to look for the expert , and be pleased to find a celebrated one chat with his own acquaintance , Pestsov .
' wonderful ! ' Pestsov be say in his deep bass .
' how do you do , Constantine Dmitrich ? ... especially shapely , plastic , and rich in colour , if one may say so , be the passage where you feel the approach of Cordelia , the woman , da ewige Weibliche , [ the eternal feminine . ] and she enter upon a struggle with fate . '
' why , what have Cordelia to do with it ? ' Levin ask timidly , having quite forget that the fantasia present King Lear on the heath .
' cordelia appear ... here ! ' say Pestsov , tap with his finger the glossy programme he be hold , and hand it to Levin .
only then do Levin recollect the title of the fantasia , and hasten to read the russian translation of a passage from Shakespeare , which be print on the back .
' you can not follow without it , ' say Pestsov turning to Levin , as the man he have be talk to have go away and he have no one else to talk to .
during the interval Levin and Pestsov begin a discussion on the merit and defect of the wagnerian tendency in music .
Levin maintain that the mistake of Wagner and of all his follower lie in try to make music enter the domain of another art , and that poetry commit the same error when it depict the feature of a face , which should be do by painting , and , as an example of this kind of error , he mention a sculptor who try to chisel the shadow of poetic image arise round the pedestal of his statue of a poet .
' the sculptor 's shadow so little resemble shadow that they even cling to a ladder , ' say Levin .
he like this phrase , but could not remember whether he have not use it before , and to Pestsov himself , and after say it he grow embarrassed .
Pestsov argue that art be all one , and that it can only reach its high manifestation by unite all the different kind of art .
Levin could not listen to the second part of the concert , for Pestsov , who stand beside he , talk all the while and find fault with the piece because of its unnecessary and sickly affectation of simplicity , compare it with the simplicity of the pre - raphaelite school of painting .

OBLONSKY 's affair be in a BAD state .
two - third of the money for the forest have already be spend , and by allow a discount of ten per cent he have obtain from the merchant almost the whole of the last third .

he have no money at all . this be unpleasant , inconvenient , and , in Oblonsky 's opinion , ought not to continue .
the cause , as he understand it , be that he receive too small a salary .
the position have certainly be a very good one a few year ago , but it be so no long .
Petrov , the Bank director , get Rs.12,ooo .
Sventitsky , Director of a company , get Rs.17,ooo ; and Mitin , having found a bank , get Rs.5o , ooo .

and he begin prick up his ear and look around , and by the end of the winter he have discover a very good post and begin an attack on it , first from Moscow through aunt , uncle , and friend ; and then in spring , when the matter have ripen , he himself go to Petersburg .
this post be one of those , now far more numerous than formerly , carry salary from one thousand to fifty thousand rouble a year : soft profitable job . it be a membership of the Committee of the Joint Agency of the Mutual Credit Balance of Southern Railways and Banking Houses .
like all such post it require such immense knowledge and activity as could hardly be unite in one man .
and as there be no one find who unite those quality , it be at any rate well for the post to be fill by an honest rather than a dishonest man .
Oblonsky be not only an honest man – place no special emphasis on the word – but he be an honest man with an emphasis , in the special sense attach to the word in Moscow , where they say : ' an honest worker , an honest writer , an honest journalist , an honest institution , an honest tendency , ' mean not only that the man or the institution be not dishonest , but also that they be capable , on occasion , of be objectionable to the government .
Oblonsky move in those Moscow circle where that word be use , and be there consider an honest man , so that he have a well claim to the post than other people .
the post carry a salary of from seven to ten thousand rouble a year , and Oblonsky could hold it without resign his official position .

' but they can not understand this , they be concern only with their private interest and be carry away by phrase . '

or an engineer get twenty thousand .

' I consider that a salary be payment for value receive and should be subject to the law of supply and demand .

as be his WONT , Oblonsky do not spend his time idly while in Petersburg .

his wife ? ...

child ?

next day he receive from Karenin a definite refusal to divorce Anna , and understand that this decision be base on what the Frenchman have say the evening before , in his real or pretended sleep .
before any definite step can be taken in a household , there must be either complete division or love accord between husband and wife .
when their relation be indefinite it be impossible for they to make any move .
many family continue for year in their old rut , hate by both husband and wife , merely because there be neither complete discord nor harmony .
both for Vronsky and for Anna life in Moscow in the heat and dust , when the sun no long shine as in spring but burn as in summer , when all the tree on the boulevard have long be in leaf and the leave be already cover with dust , be intolerable ; nevertheless they do not move to Vozdvizhensk , as they have long ago decide to do , but stay in Moscow , which have become obnoxious to they both , because of late there have not be harmony between they .
the irritation which divide they have no tangible cause , and all attempt at an explanation not only fail to clear it away but increase it .
it be an inner irritation , cause on her side by a diminution of his love for she , and on his by regret that for her sake he have place himself in a distressing situation , which she , instead of try to alleviate , make still hard .
neither of they speak of the cause of their irritation , but each think the other in the wrong , and at every opportunity try to prove that this be so .
for she he , with all his habit , thought , wish , mental and physical faculty – the whole of his nature – consist of one thing only : love for woman , and this love she feel ought to be wholly concentrated on she alone . this love be diminish ; therefore , in her judgment , part of his love must have be transfer to other woman , or to one other woman .
she be jealous , not of any one woman , but of the diminution of his love .
not have as yet an object for her jealousy , she seek one .
at the slight hint she transfer her jealousy from one object to another .
now she be jealous of the coarse woman with whom , through his bachelor connection , he might so easily have intercourse ; now of the Society woman whom he might meet ; now of some imaginary girl whom he might marry after repudiate she .
this last jealousy torment she more than anything else , especially since in an expansive moment he have carelessly tell she that his mother understand he so little that she have try to persuade he to marry the young Princess Sorokina .
and be jealous , Anna be indignant with he and constantly seek reason to justify her indignation .
she blame he for everything that be hard in her situation .
the torture of expectation , live betwixt heaven and earth , which she endure there in Moscow , Karenin 's dilatoriness and indecision , her loneliness – she attribute all to he .
if he love she he would fully understand the difficulty of her situation , and would deliver she from it .
that they be live in Moscow , instead of in the country , be also his fault .
he could not live bury in the country as she desire .
he need society , and so he have place she in this terrible position , the misery of which he would not understand .
and it be likewise his fault that she be for ever part from her son .
even the rare moment of tenderness which occur between they do not pacify she ; in his tenderness she now see a tinge of calm assurance which have not be there before and irritate she .
it be grow dusk .

the zest be go ! ' she say to herself in English .

it would be hell !
and that be just how it be .

and where love cease , there hate begin ...

no .

be any kind – not of happiness even , but of absence of torture – possible ? no !
no ! ' she now answer herself without the least hesitation . ' it be impossible !

every effort have be make , but the screw have give way ...
a beggar woman with a baby .
she think I pity she .
be we not all flung into the world only to hate each other , and therefore to torment ourselves and other ?
there go schoolboy – they be laugh .
Serezha ? ' she remember . ' I think I love he , too , and be touch at my own tenderness for he .

and again hope and despair , alternately chafe the old sore , lacerate the wound of her torture and violently flutter heart . sit on the star - shape couch , wait for her train , she look with repulsion at those who pass in and out .

PART VIII
NEARLY two month have gone by .
it be already the middle of the hot summer , but Sergius Ivanich Koznyshev be only now prepare to leave Moscow .
in Koznyshev 's life during that time event of importance for he have take place .
his book , the result of six year ' labour , entitle , an attempt to review the Foundations and Forms of Government of Europe and Russia , have be finish a year ago .
some part of it and the introduction have appear in periodical , and other part have be read by Koznyshev to people of his set , so that the idea of the work could not be very novel to the public ; but all the same Koznyshev expect that the publication of the book would create a serious impression on Society , and if not a revolution in science , at any rate a strong agitation in the scientific world .
the book have be issue last year after careful revision , and have be send out to the bookseller .
not ask anyone about it , reluctantly and with feign indifference reply to his friend ' inquiry as to how it be go , and not even ask the bookseller how it be sell , Koznyshev watch keenly and with strained attention for the first impression his book would produce in Society and in literature .
but a week pass , and another , and a third , and no impression be noticeable in Society . his friend , the specialist and the scholar , sometimes – from politeness – mention it ; his other acquaintance , not interested in learn work , do not mention it to he at all .
in Society , now particularly occupy with something else , absolute indifference reign .
in the periodical also , for a whole month , there have not be any mention of the book .
Koznyshev have calculate exactly the time necessary for a review to be write ; but a month pass , and another , and the silence continue .
only in the Northern Beetle , in a facetious feuilleton about the singer Drabanti who have lose his voice , be a few contemptuous remark interpolate about Koznyshev 's book , indicate that it have long ago be condemn by everybody and consign to general ridicule .
at last , in the third month , a criticism appear in a serious magazine .
Koznyshev know the author of the article .
he have meet he once at Golubkov 's .
the author be a very young and sickly journalist ; very bold as a writer , but extremely uneducated , and shy in personal intercourse .
despite his entire contempt for this man , Koznyshev begin read the review most respectfully .
the article be horrible .
the critic have evidently understand the book in an impossible way .
but he have so adroitly select his quotation that to those who have not read the book ( and evidently hardly anyone have read it ) it would appear quite clear that the whole book be nothing but a collection of high - sound word , not even use appropriately ( as be indicate by note of interrogation ) , and that its author be a totally ignorant man .
all this be put with so much wit that Koznyshev himself would not have be averse to wield it ; and that be what be dreadful .
notwithstanding the thorough conscientiousness with which Koznyshev verify the correctness of the critic 's argument , he do not dwell for a moment on the deficiency and mistake which be ridicule , but at once involuntarily begin to recall his meeting and conversation with the author of the review , down to the minutest detail .
' do not I offend he in some way ? ' he ask himself .
and remember how when he meet he he have correct the young man 's use of a word that betray ignorance Koznyshev find an explanation of the article .
that review be follow by dead silence both in print and in conversation concern the book , and Koznyshev see that his six year ' work , carry out with so much devotion and labour , be entirely throw away .
his position be the more painful because , having finish his book , he no long have any literary work such as have previously occupy the great part of his time .
he be intelligent , well - educate , healthy and active , but do not know how to employ his energy .
discussion in drawing - room , at meeting , at assembly , in committee , and everywhere where one could speak , take up part of his time ; but , as an habitual town - dweller , he do not allow himself to be entirely absorb by discussion , as his inexperienced brother do when he be in Moscow ; so he have much superfluous leisure and mental energy .
fortunately for he , at this most trying time , after the failure of his book , in place of the question of Dissent , our american friend , the Samara Famine , the Exhibitions , and Spiritualism , the slavonic question – which have previously only smoulder in Society – come to the front , and Koznyshev , who have previously be one of the promoter of that cause , devote himself to it entirely .
among the people to whom he belong , nothing be write or talk about at that time except the serbian war .
everything that the idle crowd usually do to kill time , it now do for the benefit of the Slavs : ball , concert , dinner , speech , lady ' dress , beer , restaurant – all bear witness to our sympathy with the Slavs .
with much that be speak and write on the subject Koznyshev do not agree in detail .
he see that the slav question have become one of those fashionable diversion which , ever succeed one another , serve to occupy society ; he see that too many people take up the question from interested motive .
he admit that the paper publish much that be unnecessary and exaggerate with the sole aim of draw attention to themselves , each outcry the other .
he see that amid this general elation in Society those who be unsuccessful or discontent leapt to the front and shout louder than anyone else : commander - in - chief without army , minister without portfolio , journalist without paper , and party leader without follower .
he see there be much that be frivolous and ridiculous ; but he also see and admit the unquestionable and ever - grow enthusiasm which be unite all class of society , and with which one could not help sympathize .
the massacre of our co - religionist and brother Slavs evoke sympathy for the sufferer and indignation against their oppressor .
and the heroism of the Serbs and Montenegrins , fight for a great cause , arouse in the whole nation a desire to help their brother not only with word but by deed .
also there be an accompanying fact that please Koznyshev . it be the manifestation of public opinion .
the nation have definitely express its wish .
as Koznyshev put it , ' the soul of the nation have become articulate . '
the more he go into this question , the clear it seem to he that it be a matter which would attain enormous proportion and become epoch - making .
he devote himself completely to the service of that great movement and forget to think about his book .
his whole time be now so take up that he be unable to answer all the letter and demand address to he .
after work all through the spring and part of the summer , it be not till July that he prepare to go to his brother 's in the country .
he go , both to enjoy a fortnight 's rest , and – in that holy of holy of the people , the very heart of the country – to enjoy the sight of that uplift of the national spirit , of which he and all the town - dweller be fully convinced .
Katavasov , who have promise Levin to visit he , and have long be mean to keep that promise , accompany Koznyshev .
