since the moment when , at the sight of his beloved and die brother , Levin for the first time look at the question of life and death in the light of the new conviction , as he call they , which between the age of twenty and thirty - four have imperceptibly replace the belief of his childhood and youth , he have be less horrified by death than by life without the least knowledge of whence it come , what it be for , why , and what it be .
organism , their destruction , the indestructibility of matter , the law of the conservation of energy , development – the term that have supersede these belief – be very useful for mental purpose ; but they give no guidance for life , and Levin suddenly feel like a person who have exchange a thick fur coat for a muslin garment and who , be out in the frost for the first time , become clearly convinced , not by argument , but with the whole of his being , that he be as good as naked and that he must inevitably perish miserably .
from that moment , without think about it and though he continue live as he have do heretofore , Levin never cease to feel afraid of his ignorance .
moreover , he be vaguely conscious that what he have call his conviction be really ignorance and , more than that , be a state of mind which render knowledge of what he need impossible .
at the commencement of his married life the new joy and new duty he experience completely stifle these thought ; but lately , since his wife 's confinement , while live in Moscow without any occupation , the problem demand solution have present itself more and more insistently to he .
for he the problem be this : ' if I do not accept the reply offer by Christianity to the question my life present , what solution do I accept ? '
and he not only fail to find in the whole arsenal of his conviction any kind of answer , but he could not even find anything resemble an answer .
he be in the position of a man seek for food in a toyshop or at a gunsmith 's .
involuntarily and unconsciously , in every book , in every conversation , and in every person he meet , he now seek for their relation to those question and for a solution to they .
what astounded and upset he most in this connection , be that the majority of those in his set and of his age , having like himself replace their former belief by new conviction like his own ; do not see anything to be distressed about , and be quite contented and tranquil . so that , besides the principal question , Levin be torment by other question : be these people sincere ?
be they not pretend ? or do they understand possibly in some different and clear way than he , the answer science give to the question he be concern with ?
and he study painstakingly both the opinion of those people and the book which contain their answer .
one thing he have discover since these question have begin to occupy he , namely , that he have be mistake in imagine from his recollection of his youthful university circle , that religion have outlive its day and no long exist .
all those near to he who live good life be people who believe : the old Prince , Lvov , of whom he have grow so fond , his brother Koznyshev , and all the womenfolk . his wife believe as he have do in early childhood , and ninety - nine out of a hundred of the russian people , the whole of the people whose life he most respect , also believe .
another thing be that , having read a great many book he become convinced that those who share his outlook understand only what he have understand , explain nothing and merely ignore those problem – without a solution to which he feel he could not live , – but try to solve quite other problem which could not interest he , such as , for instance , the development of organism , a mechanical explanation of the soul , and so on .
besides , during the time of his wife 's confinement an extraordinary thing have happen to he .
he , an unbeliever , begin xo pray , and while praying believe .
but that moment have pass , and he could not allot any place in his life to the state of mind he have then experience .
he could not admit that he have then know the truth and be now make a mistake ; because , as soon as he reflect calmly about it , it all fall to piece , nor could he acknowledge that he have then be mistaken , for he prize the state his soul have then be in , and by acknowledge it to be a result of weakness he would have defile those moment .
he be painfully out of harmony with himself and strain all his spiritual power to escape from this condition .
these thoughts oppress arid torment he , now more and now less strongly , but never leave he .
he read and think , and the more he read and think the far he feel from his goal .
latterly in Moscow and in the country , having convince himself that he could get no answer from the materialist , he read through and re - read Plato , Spinoza , Kant , Schelling , Hegel , and Schopenhauer , those philosopher who explain life otherwise than materialistically .
their thought seem to he fruitful when he read , or be himself devise refutation of other teaching , the materialistic in particular ; but as soon as he begin read , or himself devise , solution to life 's problem , the same thing occur every time .
follow long definition of vague word such as spirit , will , freedom , substance , and deliberately enter the verbal trap set for he by the philosopher , or by himself , he seem to begin to understand something .
but he have only to forget that artificial line of thought , and to return direct from real . life to what have appear satisfactory so long as he keep to the give line of thought – and suddenly the whole artificial edifice tumble down like a house of card , and it be evident that the edifice have be construct of those same word differently arrange , and without regard for something in life more important than reason .
at one time , while read Schopenhauer , he replace the word will by the word love , and this new philosophy comfort he for a day or two , as long as he do not stand aside from it ; but it , too , collapse when he view it in relation to real life , and it turn out to be a muslin garment without warmth .
his brother Koznyshev advise he to read Homyakov 's theological writing .
Levin read the second volume of they , and in spite of its polemical , polished , and witty style , which at first repel he , he be strike by its teaching about the Church .
he be strike by the thought that it be not give to isolated man to attain divine truth , but that it be give to a community unite by love – the Church .
he be pleased by the thought that it be easy to believe in an exist live Church which compound all the belief of man , and have God at its head and be therefore holy and infallible , and from it to accept belief in God , a distant , mysterious God , the Creation , and so on .
but afterwards on read the history of the Church , first by a Roman Catholic and then by a Greek - orthodox writer , and find that each essentially infallible Church repudiate the other , he become disenchanted with Homyakov 's teaching about the Church ; and that edifice fall into dust just as the philosophical structure have do .
all that spring he be not himself and experience terrible moment .
' without know what I be , and why I be here it be impossible to live .
yet I can not know that and therefore I can not live , ' he say to himself .
' in an infinity of time , and in infinity of matter , in infinite space , a bubble , a bubble organism , separate itself , and that bubble maintain itself awhile and then burst , and that bubble be – I ! '
this be a distressing falsehood , but it be the sole and last result of century and the age - long labour of human thought in that direction .
it be the late belief . it be the rule conviction and from among all other explanation Levin , without himself know when or how , have involuntarily choose it as be at any rate the clear of all .
but it be not only false , it be the cruel mockery of some evil power : a wicked and disgusting Power , and one to which it be impossible to submit .
it be necessary to free oneself from that Power .
the mean of escape be in the hand of every man .
an end have to be put to that dependence on an evil power ; and there be one means – death .
and though he be a happy and healthy family man , Levin be several time so near to suicide that he hide a cord he have lest he should hang himself , and he fear to carry a gun lest he should shoot himself .
but he do not hang or shoot himself and go on live .
when LEVIN THOUGHT about what he be and why he live , he could find no answer and be drive to despair ; but when he leave off ask himself those question he seem to know what he be and why he live , for he act and live unfalteringly and definitely – recently even more unfalteringly than before .
when he return to the country in June , he go back to his ordinary occupation – husbandry , intercourse with the peasant and with his neighbour , management of his house and of his sister 's and brother 's affair , which be entrust to he , relation with his wife and relative , care about his baby , and a new hobby – beekeeping , which he take up with enthusiasm that spring – occupy all his time .
these matter interest he , not because he justify they to himself by any general theory as he have do previously ; on the contrary , be now on the one hand disenchant by the ill - success of his former occupation for the general welfare , and on the other hand too much occupy with his own thought and by the mass of affair that overwhelm he from all side , he quite abandon all calculation of public utility , and these matter interest he only because it seem to he that he have to do what he be do , and could not act otherwise .
formerly ( it have be so almost from childhood and increasingly so till his complete maturity ) when he try to do anything for the good of everybody , for humanity , for Russia , for the whole village , he have notice that the thought of it be agreeable , but the activity itself be always unsatisfactory ; there be no full assurance that the work be really necessary , and the activity itself , which at first seem so great , ever lessen and lessen till it vanish . but now since his marriage , when he begin to confine himself more and more to live for himself , though he no long feel any joy at the thought of his activity , he feel confident that his work be necessary , see that it progress far well than formerly , and that it be always grow more and more .
now , as if involuntarily , he cut ever deeply and deep into the earth , so that he , like a ploughshare , could not get out without turn the sod .
for the family to live as their grandfather and father have be accustom to live , that be at the same educational level , and so to bring up their child , be undoubtedly necessary .
it be just as necessary as to dine when hungry ; and therefore just as it be necessary to prepare dinner , so it be necessary to arrange the husbandry at Pokrovsk in such a way as to derive an income from it .
as surely as one must pay one 's debt , so surely be it necessary to keep the patrimony in such a state that when his son inherit it , he would thank his father , as Levin thank his grandfather , for all that he have build and plant .
to do this he must not lease the land , but must farm it himself , keep cattle , manure the field , and plant wood .
it be as impossible not to look after his brother 's and sister 's affair , and those of all the peasant who come for advice and be accustom to do so , as it be impossible to abandon a baby you be already hold in your arm .
it be necessary to look after the comfort of his sister - in - law and her child , who have be invite , and of his wife and child , and it be impossible not to pass at least a small portion of each day with they .
all this , with game - shooting , and his new hobby of beekeeping , fill up the whole of that life of his which seem to he , when he think about it , to have no meaning .
but besides know definitely what he have to do , Levin also know how to do it all , and which affair be the more important of any two .
he know that he must hire labourer as cheaply as possible ; but that he must not take they in bondage for less than they be worth by advance they money , though this would be very profitable .
he might sell straw to the peasant in a time of shortage , though he feel sorry for they ; but an inn or a public - house , although it bring in a revenue , must be do away with .
felling tree must be punish as severely as possible , but if peasant let their cattle stray he must not extract fine from they ; and though it grieve the watchman and weakened discipline , the stray cattle must not be detain .
he must lend money to Peter to liberate he from the usurer to whom he be pay ten per cent . a month ; but he must neither reduce or postpone the payment of rent by the peasant who be in default .
the steward must not be excuse when the small meadow be not mown and the grass be waste ; but grass must not be mow on the eighty desyatina which have be plant with young tree .
he must not pardon a labourer who go home at a busy time because his father have die – sorry as he might be for the man – part of his pay have to be deduct for the precious month during which he have be absent ; but he could not neglect give a monthly allowance to old domestic serf who be of no use at all to he .
Levin know , too , that on return home the first thing he must do be to go to his wife , who be unwell , and that the peasant who have be wait for three hour to see he could wait a little long ; and he know that in spite of all the pleasure of hiving a swarm , he must forgo that pleasure , let the old beekeeper hive the swarm without he , and go to talk to the peasant who have find he at the apiary .
whether he be act well or ill he do not know and far from lay down the law about it , he now avoid talk or think about it .
think about it lead he into doubt and prevent he from see what he should and should not do .
but when he do not think , but just live , he unceasingly feel in his soul the presence of an infallible judge decide which of two possible action be the well and which the bad ; and as soon as he do what he should not have do , he immediately feel this .
in this way he live , not know or see any possibility of know what he be or why he live in the world , and he suffer so much from that ignorance that he be afraid he might commit suicide , while at the same time he be firmly cut his own particular definite path through life .
the day when KOZNYSHEV ARRIVED at Pokrovsk be one of Levin 's most distressing day .
it be the most pressingly busy season of the year , when an extraordinary tension of self - sacrifice labour manifest itself among all the peasant , such as be never show in any other condition of life , and such as would be highly esteemed if the people who exhibit this quality esteem it themselves , if it be not repeat every year , and if the result of that tension be not so simple .
to mow or reap the rye and oat , and cart they , to finish mow the meadow , to re - plough the fallow land , to thresh the seed corn and sow the winter rye – all this seem simple and ordinary ; yet to get it all do , it be necessary that all the peasant , from the old to the young , should work unceasingly those three or four week , three time as hard as usual , live on kvas , onion , and black bread , threshing and cart the sheaf by night and sleep not more than two or three hour out of the twenty - four .
and this be do every year , all over Russia .
having live most of his life in the country and in close contact with the peasant , Levin always feel , at this busy time , that this general stimulation of the peasant communicate itself to he .
early in the morning he ride to where the first rye be be sow , then to see the oats cart and stack , and return home when his wife and sister - in - law be get up he drink coffee with they , and then walk to the farm where the new threshing machine be to be start to thresh the seed corn .

'
stand in the cool shade of the newly - thatch barn , with its wattle wall of hazel , which have not yet shed its scented leave , press against the freshly strip aspen of the roof - tree under the thatch , he look now through the open doorway into which the dry and bitter chaff - dust rush and whirl , at the grass round the threshing - floor light up by the hot sunshine and at the fresh straw that have just be bring out of the barn , now at the bright - head and white - breasted swallow that fly in chirp beneath the roof and , flap their wing , pause in the light of the doorway , and now at the people who bustle about in the dark and dusty barn ; and he think strange thought :

' he think , look at a thin peasant woman who push the grain along with a rake , her dark sunburnt bare foot step with effort on the hard uneven barn floor . ' she recover then , but to - day or tomorrow , or in ten year ' time , they will bury she and nothing will be leave of she , nor of that smart girl with the red skirt , who with such dexterous and delicate movement be beat the chaff from the ear .

' you put in too much at a time , Theodore !
do not you see , it get jammed and that be why it do not go well !
feed it in evenly ! '

at present it be let to the innkeeper .
Levin get into conversation with Theodore about that land , and ask whether Plato , a well - to - do . and worthy peasant of that village , would not rent that land next year .

LEVIN went along the high - road with long stride , attend not so much to his thought – he could not yet disentangle they – as to a condition of his soul he have never before experienced .

these idea , though he have be unconscious of they , have be in his mind when he be talk about let the land .

' to live not for one 's need but for God !
for what God ?
what could be more senseless than what he say ?
he say we must not live for our need – that is , we must not live for what we understand and what attract we , what we wish for , but must live for something incomprehensible , for God whom nobody can understand or define .
well ?
and do I not understand those senseless word of Theodore 's ?
and having understand they , do I doubt their justice ? do I find they stupid , vague , or inexact ?
' no , I understand he just as he understand they : understand completely and more clearly than I understand anything in life ; and I have never in my life doubt it , and can not doubt it . and not I alone but every one – the whole world – only understand that completely .
nobody be free from doubt about other thing , but nobody ever doubt this one thing , everybody always agree with it . { ? ? }
' theodore say that Kirilov , the innkeeper , live for his belly .
that be intelligible and reasonable .
we all , as reasoning creature , can not live otherwise .
and then that same Theodore say that it be wrong to live for one 's belly , and that we must live for Truth , for God , and at the first hint I understand he !
I and million of man who live century ago and those who be live now : peasant , the poor in spirit , and sage , who have think and write about it , say the same thing in their obscure word – we all agree on that one thing : what we should live for , and what be good .
I , and all other man , know only one thing firmly , clearly , and certainly , and this knowledge can not be explain by reason : it be outside reason , have no cause , and can have no consequence .
' if goodness have a cause , it be no long goodness if it have a consequence – a reward , it be also not goodness .
therefore goodness be beyond the chain of cause and effect .
' it be exactly this that I know and that we all know .
{ ? ? } ' and I seek for miracle , regret not to see a miracle that might convince I !
a physical miracle would have tempt I . but here be a miracle , the one possible , everlasting miracle , all around I , and I do not notice it !
' what great miracle could there be than that ?
' can I possibly have find the solution of everything ? have my suffering really come to an end ? ' think Levin as he stride along the dusty road , oblivious of the heat , of his fatigue , and fill with a sense of relief from long - continue suffering .
that feeling be so joyous that it seem questionable to he .
he be breathless with excitement and , incapable of go far , he turn from the road into the wood and sit down on the uncut grass in the shade of the aspen .

' yes , I must clear it up and understand it , ' he think , gaze intently at the untrodden grass before he , and follow the movement of a green insect that be crawl up a stalk of couch grass and be hinder in its ascent by a leaf of goutwort . ' what gladden I ? what have I discover ?
( there ! it do not want to get on to that grass , but have spread its wing and fly away ) there take place , accord to physical , chemical , and physiological law , a change of matter .

unende evolution and struggle ...
as if there could be any direction and struggle in infinity !
and I be surprised that , in spite of the great effort of thought on that path , the meaning of life , the meaning of my impulse and my aspiration , be not reveal to I .

' I have discover nothing .
I have only perceive what it be that I know .
I have understand the Power that not only give I life in the past but be give I life now .

he briefly review the whole course of his thought during the last two year , begin with the clear and obvious thought of death at the sight of his beloved brother hopelessly ill .

but he have do neither the one nor the other , yet he continue to live , think , and feel , have even at that very time got marry , experience many joy , and be happy whenever he be not think of the meaning of his life .
what do that show ?
it show that he have live well , but think badly .
he have live ( without be conscious of it ) by those spiritual truth which he have imbibe with his mother 's milk ; but in thought he have not only not acknowledge those truth , but have studiously evade they .
now it be clear to he that he be only able to live , thank to the belief in which he have be bring up .
' what should I have be and how should I have live my life , if I have not have those belief , and have not know that one must live for God , and not for one 's own need ?
I should have rob , lie , and murder .
nothing of that which constitute the chief joy of my life would have exist for I . '
and although he make the great effort of imagination , he could not picture to himself the bestial creature he would have be , have he not know what he be live for .
' I look for an answer to my question .
but reason could not give I an answer – reason be incommensurable with the question .
life itself have give I the answer , in my knowledge of what be good and what be bad .
and that knowledge I do not acquire in any way ; it be give to I as to everybody , give because I could not take it from anywhere .
' where do I get it from ?
be it by reason that I attain to the knowledge that I must love my neighbour and not throttle he ?
they tell I so when I be a child , and I gladly believe it , because they tell I what be already in my soul .
but who discover it ?
not reason !
reason have discover the struggle for existence and the law that I must throttle all those who hinder the satisfaction of my desire .
that be the deduction reason make .
but the law of love other could not be discover by reason , because it be unreasonable . '
' ah yes ! Pride ! ' he say to himself , turn over face downwards and begin to tie blade of grass into knot , try not to break they .
' and not only mental pride but mental stupidity .
and chiefly roguery of mind , precisely roguery .
just mind - swindling , ' he repeat .
LEVIN remember a recent SCENE between Dolly and her child .

' but that be not a bee , it be a wasp , ' say Levin .
' well , and what be your theory ? ' ask Katavasov with a smile , evidently challenge Levin to a discussion . ' why have private individual no right ? '
' my theory be this : on the one hand war be such a bestial , cruel and terrible affair , that no single man – not to speak of a Christian – can take on himself personally the responsibility for begin a war . it can only be do by a government , which be summon to it and be bring to it inevitably .
on the other hand , by law and by common sense , in the affair of State and especially in the matter of war , citizen renounce their personal will . '
Koznyshev and Katavasov , ready with their rejoinder , begin speak both together .
' that be just the point , my dear fellow , that case may arise when the government do not fulfil the will of its citizen and then Society announce its own will , ' say Katavasov .

he frown at Katavasov 's word and say something different .
' it be a pity you put the question that way .

' yes , you would . '
' I do not know .
if I see such a thing , I might yield to my instinctive feeling ; I can not say beforehand .
but there be no such instinctive feeling about the oppression of the Slavs , nor can there be . '

the people have hear of their brother ' suffering , and have speak out . '

the priest be order to read it .
he do so .
the people understand nothing , but they sigh as they always do during a sermon , ' continue the Prince . ' they be tell that there would be a collection in the church for a soul - save object , so they each take out a kopek and give it , but what it be for – they do not know ! '
' the people can not help know . a consciousness of their destiny always exist in the people , and at moment like the present it become clear to they , ' say Koznyshev positively , glance at the old beekeeper .
the handsome old man , with a black beard turn grey in place and thick silvery hair , stand motionless with a bowl of honey in his hand , gaze kindly and calmly down from his height at the gentlefolk , clearly neither understand they nor wish to understand .
' that be just so , ' he say to Koznyshev , and move his head significantly .
' yes , you would well ask he !
he neither know nor think about it , ' say Levin . ' have you hear about the war , Mikhaylich ? ' he ask , address the old man .
' what they read in the church ?

' why should we think ?

he can see well ...
shall I bring some more bread and give the laddie a bit ? ' he ask Dolly , point to Grisha , who be finish his crust .

KOZNYSHEV , an EXPERIENCED DIALECTICIAN , do not rejoin but immediately turn the conversation into another region .
' well , if you want to gauge the national spirit arithmetically , of course that be very difficult to do !

" you think war unavoidable .

you know that expression be a puzzle one for a naturalist .
what be a soul ? ' Katavasov inquire with a smile .
' oh , you know ! '
' no , I swear I have not the slight idea ! ' say Katavasov , laugh loudly .

Levin flush with annoyance , not at be beat , but because he have not refrain from the dispute .

he see that it be not possible to convince his brother and Katavasov , and still less do he see any possibility of himself agree with they .
what they advocate be that same pride of intellect that have nearly ruin he .
he could not agree that some dozen of man , among whom be his brother , have the right to assert , on the strength of what they be tell by some hundred of grandiloquent Volunteers who come to the city , that they and the newspaper express the will and the opinion of the people : an opinion , moreover , which find expression in vengeance and murder .
he could not agree with this , because he neither see the expression of those thought in the people among whom he live , nor do he find any such thought in himself ( and he could not consider himself as other than one of those who constitute the russian people ) . above all , he could not agree because he , together with the people , do not know and could not know wherein lay the general welfare , but know definitely that the attainment of this welfare be only possible by a strict fulfilment of the law of goodness which be reveal to every man , and therefore could not desire or preach war for any kind of general aim .

the PRINCE and KOZNYSHEV GOT into the TRAP and drive off ; the rest of the party , hasten their step , go home on foot .

' and Catherine Alexandrovna ? ' [ speak to the servant Levin give Kitty her full name . ] Levin ask Agatha Mikhaylovna , who , carry shawl and plaid , meet they in the hall .

' and Mitya ? '
' in Kolok , I expect , and Nurse be with they . '

' alive ?

I be just wish to go when he become restless .
we have to change his thing .

I do not know what I be say ! '
they collect the wet baby - thing , and the nurse take the baby in her arm and carry he .

throughout the WHOLE DAY , amid most varied conversation in which he take part only with what one may call the external side of his mind , Levin , despite his disillusionment with the change that should have take place in he , do not cease to be joyfully aware of the fullness of his heart .

so the whole company spend the rest of the day at home .
no more dispute arise ; on the contrary , after dinner every one be in the good of spirit .
First Katavasov amuse the lady with his original joke , which on first acquaintance with he always pleased people , and afterwards , encourage by Koznyshev , he recount his very interesting observation on the difference in character , and even in physiognomy , between male and female house - fly and on their life .

he go through the verandah and look at two star that have appear on the already darken sky , and suddenly he remember : ' yes , as I look at the sky I think that the vault I see be not a delusion , but then there be something I do not think out , something I hide from myself , ' he think . ' but whatever it be , it can not have be a refutation .

it be that if the principal proof of the existence of a deity be his revelation of what be good , why be that revelation confine to the Christian Church alone ?

Kitty be stand , with her sleeve roll up , beside the bath in which the baby be splash about , and hear her husband 's step she turn her face toward he , beckon he with a smile .

when ON leave the NURSERY Levin be alone , he at once remember the thought that have not seem quite clear .
instead of go back to the drawing - room , whence come the sound of voice , he stop on the verandah and lean on the balustrade gaze at the sky .

' well , what be perplex I ? ' Levin ask himself , feel in advance that the solution of his doubt , though as yet unknown to he , be already in his soul .
' yes , the one evident , indubitable manifestation of the deity be the law of goodness disclose to man by revelation , which I feel within myself and in the confession of which I do not so much unite myself as I be united , whether I will or not , with other people in one community of believer which be call the Church .

' be it possible that those hundred of million of people be deprive of that high blessing , without which life have no meaning ? ' he ponder , but he immediately correct himself .

I be ask about the general revelation of God to the whole universe with all those cloudy nebulae .

' but I , watch the movement of the star , can not picture to myself the rotation of the earth and I be right in say that the star move .
' and could the astronomer understand and calculate anything if they take into their calculation the whole of the complicated and varied motion of the earth ?
all their wonderful conclusion as to the distance , weight , movement , and disturbance of the heavenly body be base on their visible movement round a stationary earth – on this very movement that be now before I , and which have be the same to million of people during the century , and that have be and will be the same and can always be verify .
and just as astronomer ' conclusion would be idle and uncertain be they not base on observation of the visible sky in relation to one meridian and one horizon , so would my conclusion be idle and uncertain be they not found on that understanding of goodness which be and will be the same always and for every one , and which have be reveal to I by Christianity and can always be verify in my soul .
the question of other creed and their relation to the deity I have not the right or possibility of decide . '

'
